Wren Sofia's life was like an inspirational fairytale--at least until today. From lower-class origins, the brown-furred wolfess simply did her best to survive, graduating high school with no special honors while working part-time--and then full-time afterwards--to support her struggling family. She was always a beautiful woman, with striking red hair and a stunning figure, prime target growing up on the mean streets of the city, but her older brothers kept her safe, preserving her innocence against the cruelty of the world. Still, she had been forced to watch others be victimized, and she developed a strong sense of empathy for the oppressed.

When the Prime Alpha chose her to be his wife like the Prince in Cinderella, she owed it to her family to accept immediately, and she felt she owed it to the world to do her part in making it a better place. And she did. As the Prime Alphaess, Wren conducted diplomatic missions to all of the nations of Beldor, forging peace with many age-old enemies of the Lupin through her sincere heart and simple beauty. Even many of the people of Beldor who hated the Lupin had to respect and love the woman who strove for peace. On this very day, she had been on her way to give an address to her people, pleading for their support as they try to end the war with the Feline nation. For the cats, it was too little too late.

The earth shook, and Wren leaned out the window of her limo to see the most enormous mink that ever existed looming over her and thousands of other Lupin in the city center. She was fortunate enough to be on the opposite side of the skyscraper that caught the giantess's interest, watching as knees thicker and longer than any man-made construct crashed down at both ends of the street where she was, sending her limo bouncing nearly a dozen feet into the air. Everyone within was tossed around, but Wren knew it was not safe to remain inside as she watched the mink easily lift one of the tallest buildings in the city, and she leapt out the door just as a car-sized chunk of concrete crushed the limo behind her. Wren hoped her faithful aides and driver had escaped the vehicle.

Wearing the high heels and long, red dress she had chosen to give her address in made running a fruitless task--assuming she even had a chance to escape if the giant minkess had singled her out. Thankfully, it appeared she had not, and the sky was empty and silent for a time, leaving panic and chaos in the streets until, and even more when, the sky glimmered unnaturally once again. When she saw the mouse woman, incomprehensibly massive, reaching down to dig the capital city of the Lupin people out of the ground, all rational thought was gone. There was nowhere to run, but Wren ran, as did most of the rest of the dust-sized Lupin--anyone else huddled down sobbing or gibbering incoherently. Running as fast as she could, however, the beautiful wolfess could not outpace the hurricane-force winds that began to pull her back, and up, lifting her and thousands of others from the city streets into the gargantuan mouse's nostrils. While she watched others die on impact with the unyielding nasal hairs--each hundreds of times longer than any of them was tall--Wren was lucky enough to land in a deposit of mucus, her back to the pool of viscous fluid that trapped her arms and legs, leaving her squirming helplessly in the mouse's nose. "I'm the Alpha, what have you done here?" Demands the royal wolf, staring bravely upwards at the giant cat,

"We've made you tiny and, as I said before, if you com quietly and follow our orders then on one will be hurt."

The Alpha growls and barks out again, "What do you mean follow orders? We have not attacked you, why have you done this to us?"

H'shor could only giggle at the tiny wolf's attempt to seem in control. He...
1132.title: Worship the feline package.

choices: Jarret heads towards the giant jaguar, hoping for his protection
Jarret flees inside a small shop, hoping to hide
1133.content:
Jarret, a young male wolf, was aware of the uneasy cold-war between the wolves and the felines, but no idea of the steps his leaders had prepared to take in order to secure their dominance. He was simply a middle class tradesman, until the blinding light filled the city and the monsterous jaguar suddenly appeared, towering hundreds of feet tall over the village.

He was strolling down a busy main intersection when the beast appeared, flooding the air with his heady musky scent, crouching down, smothering a few hapless citizens and their automobiles beneath is enormous fluffy testicles. Before the titanic feline started giving orders in his booming voice, Jarret even had time to recognize him by sight, although the two had never spoken more than a couple of words.

It was H'shor, a thinner, male jaguar Jarret had seen around the village a few times in local taverns. He'd even sympathized with his position as a somewhat weaker male. Being of the middle class himself, Jarret's options to ascend to the upper class were limited, since he didn't posses the strong, muscular build of the ruling alpha class. Seeing the jaguar now, however, titanic and nude as he was, he felt that H'shor might have had a slim upper body, but seemed to make up for it with his prodigious endowment. Perhaps it was just the overpowering musk or the intense size difference, but Jarret felt more than submissive to the large display of maleness a few yards down the street.

When the Jaguar spoke, his booming voice causing windows to rattle in their panes and seeming to vibrate the very air around him, chaos erupted all around, wolves fleeing in panic, degenerating almost into a mob-like mentality, even scratching and biting their neighbors in their desperation to get away.

Jarret, being weaker than many of the others, realized that he was nearly as likely to be torn apart by his own countrymen in their panic than the massive feline crouched overhead. He quickly decided that he needed to obtain a measure of protection for himself, and quickly...
1133.title: Chaos! The wolves flee!

114.content:
The various species of the Earth all share in large part the same continent and in some places share the land. Next to the wolf village, their was a human one, which observed the exchange, but in large part took no action. Word of what had happened spread, but they were neutral and would take no action.

Unknown to all sides, a few human kids had been playing in and around the Wolf village. Most of them were shrunken but a handful were beyond the blast's reach. After the village stopped shrinking a 7 person group made of wolves and humans came in to find the village. Normally, the village was made of small buildings and spanned perhaps a quarter mile. At the moment, that quarter mile was in an 8 inch space.

The group came over and stood around the village, on a global scale it had been small, now it was tiny on all scales. Its tallest buildings, 400 feet tall were barely touching the 3 inch line. The humans looked down and marveled, they could crush the whole place in two steps. The large lupines were amazed to have toes bigger than what they had once considered big buildings.

In the village, everyone stared up at the immense structures around them. They had five, eight and ten year old cubs overhead so big they'd have to climb their tallest building just to get a chance to see over their toes while on the ground, people looked up at the gigantic splayed structures and the dark cascm between them. The humans above were viewed worse. Tiny's saw giant human toes on platforms called flip-flops and sandals as well as with sneakers or barefoot that all well dwarfed the village or at least most did. It was perhaps worse for those below who were the 'big' brothers and sisters to the titanic figures surrounding them, it didn't make matters any better that the tiny ones were around a millimeter tall and the giants were made of a few thousand of them.
114.title: Human Intervention

1142.content:
Inside this village there was a top secret project. It had been rumored that the cats were making a weapon like this. For self-defense, the wolves took on the same mission and hid it in a remote place where it should have been safe, clearly it was not.

The scientists readied their device and fired, filling the air above their city with a blue glow...
1142.title: Special Toy

11421.content:
The kids around the village, and the village's inhabitants are blinded for several minutes from the ray's intense light. When it passes, it seems as if the village is gone. Given the size troubles going around, the kids got down close to see if it had simply gotten smaller.

A very careful examination does eventually find the city. The kids are looking down at a 16th of an inch in diameter speck, its so small now that they could easily get it on a claw and move it that way. From below, tiny people are looking up at 24 mile tall grass, human toes 4 miles tall, wolf and fox paws 12 miles tall and kids who dwarf the tallest mountains of the planet.

From the distance, the giants hear odd noises, it is no doubt the feline military approaching...
11421.title: Smaller village

114211.content: There's wolf, fox and feline cubs present. They get along peaceably, there is no war or ill feelings among them. Now however, the cat army was coming and the city had to be hidden, but on a canid or a feline?
114211.title: Hide the city on themselves

1142111.content:
In all truth, putting the city on a canid just wasn't going to work. Undoubtedly the foxes, wolves, and dogs would all get arrested and searched. The village was only a speck but better safe than sorry ruled the day, especially given how easily such a tiny thing could be damaged and destroyed. Flex one wrong muscle and the little civilization would end up a splat on a shirt.

As the group prepared to move and conceal the village, they noticed something: tiny, but bigger than the village, creatures. A quick examination revealed that some people had been just a bit too close and wound up shrunken. Oddly, it wasn't everyone in close proximity to the little speck. Four or five small, but not infiniteismal creatures were around the speck.

Quickly, a plan was formed, mostly through gestures and magnifying glasses. Two teenage lynx's provided transportation, twins a guy and a girl. Their massive feet sat right at the around around the speck and below, the five not-quite micro creatures divided the city and in two groups headed to a giant. Two wolf guys going to the girl lost any ego they'd ever had when they looked up to see that the furry wall eclipsed the sun.

For the little creatures, it was difficult and messy work. These barefoot giants were a mess with mud and dirt and being smaller than fleas meant that the only way through was to go around. On the giant boy it was especially bad, he made kid-quakes every-second, unable to sit completely still.

Of course, it was worst on the villages, being carried by one giant, onto another giant, and of course all the while work continued to get the shrink-ray turned into a growth ray. It could only really be a source of trouble.

At last, the tiny creatures had themselves in some sort of position where they would be able to hold out. They were still on gigantic feet, but it was among the safer places, given that people usually didn't touch other's paws and it was safer if for some reason the giant's had to be abandoned. The only question now was wether to run or wait on the military...
1142111.title: Cats to the rescue

11422.content:
The kids were close to the city, a bit too close. The initial blast just tickled their toes, but it was enough of a reaction to spread through them. To make matters worse, the group around the city had grown a bit in numbers which caused some interesting effects. In any case, everything that grew had 250 feet for every inch it had been tall.

A lot of kids looked down and around at trees which were practically fuzz against their feet and in the middle of them was the village, normal sized, at least to the world. For them it was still a tiny thing that could fit underfoot. A few kids were now the strongest thing in the known worlds, so big that bullets probably wouldn't get through their skin and artillery shells would be more like midget fire crackers.

As for those with the odd effects, those kids who'd crowded around were just a bit too far away, however some things on them had been able to get hit anyway. Kids who had shoes still to be for example, their feet would be too far back but the footwear would grow. Oddly the devices effects transferred through living things well, but not so much for non-living. As a result, huge bits of jewelry, footwear and in some cases clothes surrounded a few ordinary sized people.

One wolf was surrounded by a gigantic metal wall, a toe ring of all things. A handful of human kids were either on or in shoes, socks, flip-flops, sandals, shirts and more that was a few hundred times too large for them. If only they'd been just a bit closer to the village.

Meanwhile, the feline army still advanced...
11422.title: Almost...

11423.content:
The glow faded, all the scientists left their building to look up and everything still towered over them. In defeat, they returned to their device to continue working, and missed their greatest success. It was not for the city, but the giants around it.

Everyone surrounding the city looked down and wondered what it would be like that small, all but three anyway. In a snap, that thought, combined with the radiation they just got, caused them to shrink! In an instant, two humans and two wolves were staring up at their friends' toes and beyond them, their upper bodies. Of all the giants, the barefoot five year old seemed the most menacing, coated in mud this low, he seemed more like a machine.

The second the tiny things saw that, their thoughts reversed, they wanted to be big! As before, the effect reversed itself, but they had to concentrate harder, growing was uphill plus doing it often burned a lot of energy. Their friends had only started to notice the absence when they grew back to normal size. For the tiny ones, it was amazing to see everything getting smaller, their horizon moving off and away, all that.

At the woods, around the edge of the shrink zone, the other humans and various species of cubs watched in awe as they saw this. It was sort of like the super-heroes from their comic books and cartoons. Numerous ideas of good, evil and neutral came through their minds.

Inside the village, the spectacle was watched, but the low perspective made them think the people either walked away or had shrunken. It was a very contested thing. One was pessimism the other optimism. Unfortunately, their tiny ears heard only booms from above, so easdropping would do little to end the fight.

The giant cubs, talked among themselves to plan what to do...
11423.title: super-cubs

1143.content: None of these things happen, so, what does?
1143.title: Some other things effect the village...

11431.content:
On the ground, the tiny village glows and then shrinks yet again! As it dwindles in size, the giants around it lean in to see just how much smaller it gets. It at last stops at a little less than an inch. Its tiny residents may well not even be visible to a normal person anymore and the whole place was smaller than one of the kid's pads.

Down in the village, the second shrink wasn't as clean as it appeared from above. A few who hadn't gotten the full blast, didn't shrink, which left the people with a few 50 foot tall humans, wolves, foxes and other animals. Those 'giants' were wreaking havoc as there was hardly room for them anywhere.

Overhead, the giants...
11431.title: Village gets smaller

11432.content:
Around the city, the crowd of giants had grown to a 'small' group of fifteen with people of the main species present. Everyone was focusing on the little village in an attempt to make out every little detail, to confirm it was the village and not some intricate toy. The longer they stared, the more they saw.

After a few minutes, a small number in the group realized something was happening. The new details they saw weren't from concentrating on the city, they were shrinking! Their height dropped like stones, soon the grass that had once been at their ankles was at their tallest persons' heads. Inches quickly became feet, small things became big, their very foot and paw prints turned into giant pits.

Throughout the shrinking, everyone moved in closer to the village, small people stay with small people, better odds of being found and helped. As they approached however, the group immediately realised they were not to be with the shrunken village for rescuing. At the edge of town, they looked up at everything, the shoe was on the other foot and the milimeter tall denizens of the village seemed like miles tall titans.
11432.title: Who's bigger know?

114321.content: The "small" group stepped up onto the asphalt that made up the street leading into the village. The group began to feel immense rumblings and earthquakes as they got closer to the "giants". A few of the brighter ones of the group watched the activity of the village citizens and were prepared when a large blue wolf walked toward them. They immediately scattered, heading for the edge of the street, by the sidewalk. However, the more oblivious of the group did not. They were too busy looking at the ground or at other giant citizens and thus failed to notice the giant furry paws headed right for them. The question now is, is the big, blue wolf oblivious?
114321.title: Run towards the city anyway

1143211.content: By now only three of the fifteen super-small "people" were in the road, a wolf, a coyote, and a tiger. They stopped talking amongst themselves when the rumblings got even worse. They were nearly being thrown off of their feet! Apparently, this was the thing needed to make them start paying attention. They froze in shock and awe at the sight of the huge, mile-tall, blue behemoth of a wolf. The huge feet were alternately lifted high into the air before crashing down with increasingly powerful booms and tremors. All the three could do was watch as the humongous toes got closer and closer, covering 1/3 of a mile with each step. Are the three doomed?
1143211.title: BIG paws and little people in the way.

11432111.content: Unfortunately, the three are doomed, as they stand utterly paralyzed at the wolf's unspeakably large toes draw nearer. They could do nothing as the blue toes squish on them, utterly obliterating them. Not even a tiny blood stain remained.
11432111.title: Stepped on.

choices: Switch to a wolf spy's POV
12.content: "Dang our cannon overheated this will take at least a decade to fix. " you hear someone shout as your leader slams his fist down on a table and swears . "Get to work on it immediately!" he shouts. You begin to worry about the condition of the cannon and go with the engineers.
12.title: Malfunction

choices: The shrinking effects stretch far beyond the land of cats
121.content:
You head down to where the weapon is stored with the engineers to check on exactly what is going on. Your tail bristles nervously unsure of what could possibly have caused the problem. A ton of work went into this, numerous test and diagnostics have been done before attempting to fire this. You weren't an engineer, you didn't understand everything that went into it, but it seemed incredibly unlikely the weapon would simply overheat. So if it wasn't a random malfunction then that left the possibility of sabotage.

That was a scary possibility. Who would sabotage it? An enemy spy? A traitor without the cat's own ranks? A third party? You quickly licked a paw and attempted to pat your bristled fur down to try and appear more calm. As soon as you arrived at your destination the engineers spread out and began checking various pieces of machinery and computers.

"That's strange." One of the engineers speaks up. You looked over at her, a tigress examining a console. "Everything in here seems to be running normally. I'm not showing any actual errors."

"But the weapon overheated when we tried to fire it? How is that possible!"

Your fur bristled again and you felt your ears lower against the top of your head. Something was very wrong. You walked over to the central computer that was attached to the power reactor of the shrink ray. The display read 'Ready to Fire' on it as if the cats upstairs hadn't attempted to fire the ray again. You tapped a few buttons on the machine to determine if it was working. The computer didn't react, and instead the 'Ready to Fire' message continued to blink on the screen. You looked for a power button seeing if you could restart the computer. There was none. You tried removing the front panels to see if you could disconnect the wires manually. Your tail went limp at what you saw inside.

Sitting inside the the panel was a mess of wires which you expected. However all these wires for for some reason connected to an acorn. An acorn? What kind of insane cat would attempt to run their super weapon off an acorn! No cat that's who! There was only one group insane enough to do something like that.

Oh... Oh no. Realization dawned. It was sabotage, and you knew who was behind it.

Suddenly the computer screen updated to display 'Firing in 10.' It started to slowly count down the seconds. You weren't sure what would happen if it fired off, but you knew the cats upstairs hadn't started this and there was no time to waste.

9
8
7


You attempted to rip the acorn out from the panel beneath the computer. It wouldn't bulge. The wires were far stronger than they had any right to be.

6
5
4

You tried to tear at the wires with your claws. What kind of material were these made of? Sure your claws weren't going to do anything absurd like slice through metal but they should have at least been able to cut through these wires like paper!

3
2
1

You were out of time. Whatever was about to happen you couldn't stop it.

"Everyone get down!" You gave a warning as you dove for cover behind a pile of boxes. All you could think to yourself was, 'Please don't explode. Please don't explode. Please don't explode.'

And then a bright light filled the entire room.
121.title: Sabotage!?

choices: THEY already are on the scene
THEY might not be here yet but the wolves know about this
The Long Long Walk Back to the Command Center
1212.content:
After the bright flash everything seemed to go dark and you felt like there was a draft in the room. Something heavy landed on top of you, something made up of some kind of fabric. It was like a tent canvas or something, but much softer.You scrambled trying to find our way out from under it. As you did your tail brushed your leg and you looked down at yourself realizing that you were in fact completely naked standing in your bare fur as you entered this world.

Ohhhh no. It didn't take a rocket science to figure out cause and effect here. Your people had been working on a giant shrink ray, there was a flash and now you were naked and buried underneath some kind of fabric. You had clearing shrunk and this fabric was part of what would be an article of clothing that you were wearing moments ago.

You scrambled on all fours to get out from underneath your discarded clothes. It took time but eventually you came out into an alien landscape. The floor seemed to stretch on forever in every direction. You could see the computer monitor you had been working on previously in the distance, now seeming like some kind of ivory tower that stretched into the sky forever. Everything was way to big as you turned and looked back at your own clothes you could make out individual threads in your shirt you had been wearing. You were quite small, like an insect. You looked around for signs of any of your other feline comrades. Some of them, also ant sized had made it out from beneath their own now to small clothing. Others you didn't see and guessed they still might be stuck.

Your tail quivered as you held it low between your legs. The world was a very strange place now. if the wolves found out about this, well that might be the better of options. You remembered the acorn you had seen in the machine. It seemed right now the cats had an enemy that was much more dangerous than the wolves. They weren't as strong but they were insane and now they'd be a lot bigger.

You looked towards the doors you had come in from to enter this room. You had to get back to the command center. You'd have no problem getting underneath the door crack but operating an elevator was out of the question. That just left the stairs which seemed an even more impossible task now. Yet you couldn't stand around and do nothing. There was no telling how much time you had before THEY would be on the scene.
1212.title: All the cats shrink

12121.content:
You ran for the door out of the room, it seemed an impossible distance and the idea of climbing the stairs seemed even more impossible once you were threw it. Well, today was going to be a day for impossible things it seemed. However as you neared the door it opened on its own accord, and standing on the other end of it was a massive creature.

Well that wasn't entirely true. It was shorter than everything else in this lab, and in comparison to the equipment here it was probably somewhere around eight to nine inches tall. However compared to your diminutive size it was like a massive monster out of kaiju.You looked up in at the beast as your fur bristled nervously. A long thin body and a busy tail. Your worst fears had been realized.

SQUIRRELS.

Squirrels were always known to be... a little nutty. They did science experiments that not even the most demented wolf (or cat for that matter) would even dream of. The only good thing about squirrels is like most rodents they were small enough not to be a huge threat in combat. Oh boy was the shoe on the other foot now. You and the other cats were at a size far beneath rodents, you were practically rodent sized in comparison to something like a mouse, there was no way of beating these now massive squirrels in a direct encounter.

You immediately started to stumble back, looking for a place to hide. More squirrels appeared from behind the door and soon swarmed into the room. Now you had to worry about not just trying to stay hidden, but trying to avoid being stepped on. You ran for the crates you had dove behind earlier, trying to get underneath them to hide yourself from the squirrels. Other cats were running as well, but squirrels were scooping them up and dropping them into what looked like test tubes then jamming a cork into them leaving the felines trapped inside. just what kind of insane experiment were they planning. You forced your body flat against the floor as you wedged your way under the crate. Hopefully here you could evade capture and come up with a plan of action to save your fellow felines from whatever plan the nefarious squirrels had for them.
12121.title: THEY already are on the scene

choices: Do some kind of crazy experiment!
Sell tiny cats and wolves as pets!
121212.content:
You kept to your hiding place watching in fear. You did your best not to move or make a sound. The cats had lost this fight and the best you could do was try to make it to the next fight. You just hoped that you had escaped notice. You were not so lucky.

Suddenly, you felt something pinch the tip of your tail and you were dragged out from beneath the crate you had hidden under. You suddenly found yourself as eye level with a squirrel who was examining your tiny furred body. He held a pair of tweezers in one paw that was currently clamped around your tail before producing a test tube with his other paw and dropping you into it. Thankfully the fall didn't hurt as you landed on solid glass. The only upside to being this small was that you didn't make enough of an impact when falling down to hurt yourself.

You looked up just in time to see the cork go over the test tube leaving you trapped inside.

"Beautiful!" The squirrel holding your test tube spoke. She seemed to be in charge. She was dressed in only a lab coat and goggles as she observed the other squirrels round up your remaining cat allies. "Everything has gone according to plan." She looked down at you. "Oh you really should consider yourselves lucky, today you're helping further the cause of science!"

"Seriously?" For a brief moment you forgot to be afraid and just managed to cock an eyebrow at her as you stared through the glass of the test tube.

"Oh you cats and your little enemies the wolves have always been so silly!" The squirrel said. "But your petty wars served as the perfect grounds for experiments! Did you know the plans for your little pet project were stolen? I bet you didn't! The cats thought they had stolen the blueprints from the wolves! The wolves found an almost identical set of blueprints they thought they had stolen from the cats! In reality, it was all from us! Both weapons fired off and worked exactly as they're supposed to!" The squirrel grinned. "Does that give you solace? Knowing that just like you now at their own headquarters all the wolves have been similarly shrunken?"

You banged your hands on the side of the test tube. Okay, sure it was nice to know the wolves got what was coming to them, but not even a wolf deserved to be a prisoner of war to the squirrels! And cats certainly didn't deserve it!

"Oh but I bet you're wondering how we got here so fast without risking being shrunk ourselves." The squirrel continued.

"No not really." You muttered. "But I don't think you can actually hear me and I suspect you're the type that likes to hear themselves talk."

"The weapons can target someone based on their genetic coding." The squirrel explained. "That means when it went off only cats shrunk. Any squirrels, other animals or even inanimate objects in range of its effects were completely unaffected!"

"Well..." You looked down at your naked body and then out across the room where your discarded clothing was. "I suppose that explains some things."

"So now, every single cat and wolf on this entire planet, shrunk to the size of insects in an instant! And they all did it to themselves! And now want to know what's next?"

"Probably some kind of crazy experiment..." You muttered to yourself as you sat down in the test tube with your legs crossed.

"Next we're going to!-"
121212.title: Captured!

1212121.content:
"We're going to use you in an experiment!" The squirrel shouted.

"Of course you are." You sighed and curled your tail around yourself. There was nothing you could do. You and the other felines trapped in test tubes were carefully packed away into padded bags to ensure the test tubes wouldn't break or come loose. As the backpack was closed everything went dark. Luckily felines could see in pretty well in the dark, but there wasn't much to see other than the other shrunken cats each trying to cope with the situation. You saw some from the command center, and others that you were sure were civilians. It seemed likely there wasn't a single cat in the world who had escaped this shrinking.

Time passed, but you weren't sure how much. You could feel the bag jostle every now and then. You knew the squirrels were transporting all of you somewhere but you had no idea where. Probably some kind of secret lab. Every now and then everything would go still and the squirrels would remove the test tubes from the backpack. You always seemed to be outdoors when this happened, and would be released from the test tube, but surrounded but in an area surrounded by a small barrier the squirrels could easily step over but seemed inescapable to you. Even on the other side you could see blades of grass as tall as trees so wouldn't get far if you escaped.

During these times you were given food as well as time to answer the call of nature before you would be forced back into the test tube then placed back in the backpack. Well at least the squirrels didn't intend on letting the cats starve to death anytime soon, but the fact they wanted all of you alive was even more worrying.

You weren't sure how many days had passed before you finally reached your destination. Trapped inside that backpack you had lost all sense of direction or time. This time when they opened the bag you were inside a building. You couldn't make out much more than the ceiling from the roof unfortunately, but they started removing the test tubes from the bag three at a time. Your turn came and you and two other felines were dumped cylinder shaped box before a lid was snapped over it leaving you in the dark again.

You looked at the other two felines with you, a lioness and a panther. You were the only house cat in this group.

"Well... at least we can walk around in here." The lioness said stretching as she did. "Been trapped in those tubes so long I was worried my legs were going to stop working."

"I get what you mean." The panther dropped to all fours to stretch out.

You took your own chance to stretch and get used to moving around again. By this point you were starting to get used to being so small if only because it had been several days now. You didn't even feel awkward about the fact all three of you were standing here naked. After being stuck this way for awhile the edge of being in your bare fur tended to dull down.

"So... any idea what they have planned?"

"None." The lioness said. "Are intel on the squirrels has always been spotty at best.Half of it is intentionally made up just to throw us off and all of it sounds like a crazy conspiracy theory. There is nothing at this point I'd put beyond them."

Soon you got you answer. The box you were in fell apart on the walls leaving you standing on a colorful table with neon red and white lights surrounding it. Not far from your table was a second one with blue and white lights. On this table there was another box, that like yours had fallen apart. Standing inside of it were three wolves that had been shrunken to the same tiny size as you and your cat allies.

"What the actual hell?" You heard the panther mutter under his breath.

"Ladies and gentleman!" A squirrel popped up between the two tables towering over both cats and wolves. "Welcome to the grand event you've all been waiting for! Welcome to the first episode of War of the Species! Here! We find different species that are at war, capture them and bring them here to compete in a series of head to head contest for your entertainment! At the end of the day! The winning side goes free! Maybe... And the losing side, I don't know maybe we'll shrink them even smaller we'll get to that!"

"They've got to be kidding... A TV show?" You asked. "That's what this is about?"

"Well..." The lionness watched the squirrel and then the wolves. "Squirrels are eccentric, this is not out of character for them. Best option for now might be just to play along until we can come up with an escape plan."

"Now then!" The squirrel hosting the show you were trapped on shouted. "It's time for our first event! Shall we open with a team challenge! Or make this one on one!"
1212121.title: A Crazy Experiment Indeed

choices: Follow a wolf victim of the shrinking
1213.content:
Much to the surprise of the wider world, and not to the surprise of the rodent races, the shrink cannons that the wolves and cats hadn't been developing were indeed sabotaged. But what was the most surprising, was the spread of the sabotage, it was worldwide, across the entire world, the inhabitants of the superpowers found themselves now the size of mice. But without the advantage of weapons, clothes, and technology sized for them like the mice did.

Cats found themselves buried under their clothes as the shrink wave crossed their country, wolves too were stranded even in their own homes, quite a few individuals found themselves sucked down their bath or shower drains. The foxes, though isolated due to the stigma against them, were not spared the rodent sabotage, they reduced in size as well.

A new world order had appeared overnight, the various rodent hordes marching victoriously into the cities and villages of the cats, wolves, and foxes. Some would perhaps be benign, others would be callous and cruel to their new subjects, even more so to the cats by the mice no doubt.

A few rodents feared this would create a new Cold War between the various rodent powers, but most did not listen, the wanted to own the predators who used to dominate the world, no matter the cost.
1213.title: The shrinking effects stretch far beyond the la...

choices: The machine is charging up again?
12131.content:
A lot of things happened during that brief flash of light. The jump behind the pile of boxes you made stretched on forever, then your clothes began to come loose and finally you hit the ground. Not on hard floor, but on something soft. The bright light the weapon had emitted was dying down and was replaced with darkness.

Not complete darkness, though. You could still see some faint light coming from the turns and folds of the fabric-like material that was now surrounding you. It was certainly alarming but you pressed on, crawling forward and upward until you breached the surface. Your fur bristled when took stock of your surroundings.

Everything looked huge. The boxes you jumped behind now looked as tall as a building and looking down at your paws you also realized with a jolt that the material you were standing on were actually all your clothes. You had shrunk! As for the others, you couldn't hear a thing except the ambient hum of machinery. The likely explanation was that they too were all shrunk and were too far away to hear.

Vaulting down the mountain of clothes your paws hit cold ground. Having a look around, the room the weapon was in seemed monolithic and the ceiling might as well have been another sky. Unfortunately you had no time to sight-see, something terrible had happened and now you could hear rhythmic footsteps flooding the room. Running to the closest box, you peaked out.

From the brief second you poked your whiskers out you saw what looked to be a bunch of rodents storming the room and the first extremely obvious fact you picked up on was that they weren't shrunk. While they were still small in comparison to all the equipment in the room, they looked to be of just about your size, if not bigger. Even their guns which were once considered laughable peashooters to the cats now looked like deadly killing machines.

Risking another peak out at the invading rodents, you could see some of them run up to multiple piles of clothes scattered around the weapon with their firearms drawn. The tiger lady from before as well as many others were forced to put their hands up and surrender, any weapons they might have been carrying now rendered useless due to their size.

You stopped looking again, scared they might see you. Even the exact species of the invading force was still lost on you but right now you had to make a decision; try and hide or surrender.
12131.title: Continue with the cat scientist

choices: The journey to exit the lab
A look at the surrounding military base under occupation
121311.content:
Deciding to mimic your cheetah ancestors, that being discretion was the better part of valor, hiding seemed to be a much better idea than surrendering. Taking a leap off the mountain of clothes, you managed to find a grip on the side of a nearby box, and began to climb in between the boxes, moving up or down depending on any obstacles.

RAATTATTATAATATAAATAATTAATA!!!!!!

The sudden report of machine gun fire startled you, thankfully the yelp of fear was masked by the guns, but your grip failed. Down and down you fell, the pitch black pit between the boxes swallowing you up in moments before, just as quickly, you hit the ground.

"Oowww..." you groaned quietly, laying there on your chest, gently rolling over and cupping your sheathed crotch, not exactly a stellar landing. Laying there in pain, you were glad that no bones were broken, what with being smaller and lighter dealing with the square-cube law, gravity, and acceleration. Looking up from you position, there was a small glimmer of light, so tiny that you would've missed it had you landed just a little bit to either side.

Crawling as quietly as possible, you managed to peak through the crack between the boxes, and quickly brought a hand to your mouth. Half of the researchers were dead, their bodies riddled with what were once ineffective jokes, now the head researcher had almost been cut in half by the amount of gunfire.

"Stupid fur balls." You heard one of the rodent soldiers say, massive bushy tail behind him, definitely a squirrel. "You'd think they'd understand their new pecking order on the food chain, but I guess they were just too stupid."

"At least they's ain't the wolves." Another voice said, its accent reminding you of a mouses, "Cluny and Mercurio of the rats brought their swarms down on them... hard. Don't know how many'll be left come morning."

The two chuckled as you stared, paralyzed with fear as the dead eyes of the tigress scientist, Linda, gazed unblinkingly at you. When the two rodents left, you backed away from the gap in the boxes, curled up as far away from the hole a second possible, and cried behind your hand. You're not sure how long you sat there crying, but you know that the random bursts of gunfire you'd occasionally hear echo down the halls had diminished.

You are cheetah, you decide, rage overtaking sorrow as you stand up to your new full height, barely coming up to the chest of a mouse. Shimmying yourself back up the boxes, you climb, intent on finding any others who hadn't been captured and starting a resistance, from the glance at the now gutted and damaged shrink ray, you realize that you have to bid on the wolves machine being still operationa if you want to return things to normal.

Standing there proudly, naked as the day you were born and tiny, you had decided to fight back, but first you needed friends, and weapons.
121311.title: Hide among the boxes

choices: The mice walk by and leave
You spot a group of cats in the corner of the room
1213111.content:
There was nothing left for you in the lab. The machine was too damaged to be of use and to add on top of that, a bunch of squirrels had started disassembling the wreckage. From your vantage point you could also see some rodents ransacking drawers and cupboards, snatching up any documents and papers before throwing them in a pile. The jerry can to the side of it makie it obvious that they planned on burning them. It was clear they wanted the existence of the weapon to be completely removed, lest it be used to reverse the shrinking that effected all the other species of the world.

You shuddered to think that the rats might be doing the same thing to the wolves weapon but on the slight chance that they weren't, it became your only option. But first things first, you had to get out of the lab. Impatiently flicking your tail, you waited for a good time to flee.

A mouse soldier came over and investigated your clothing for a while but left in a huff when he couldn't find you. Thankfully he didn't bother checking between the boxes. The mouse walked up to a squirrel who you assumed was the superior officer and reported to him. "Can't find any more cats in the lab, sir. Some of them might have fled outside."

The statement annoyed the squirrel. "We'll find them soon enough. Bring any escapees to the designated holding area outside the base and separate them, I want to make an example of them so they learn quickly what inconveniencing their new masters gets them."

His words made your ears fold back, not in fear but in anger. Quietly seething, you waited for them to leave until there were only a few rodents left in the lab and considering they were busy dismantling the weapon, you saw an opportunity to leave. Leaving the safety of the boxes, you began to exfiltrate the room. Going behind the desk and slinking alongside the wall you got out surprisingly easy, but as you looked down the gigantic hallway you realized your journey had only just started.

You felt even more naked than you already were as you trotted through the empty corridor, keeping a keen ear out for any footsteps. More than once you nearly walked right into some soldiers before making a quick turn down another hallway but slowly but surely, you were getting closer to the exit.

Then, you suddenly saw a group of three mice turn a corner walking right towards you. Your fur fluffed up in fright and you shoved yourself against a door, dearly hoping they didn't see you. The doorway itself was enough to conceal you but if they walked past they were definitely going to spot you. For a moment you thought your journey was already about to come to an end but as you leaned against the door, it moved slightly. It was open!

Pushing with all your might, you somehow managed to open it just enough to get inside. The room was dark and full of metal drawers, probably acting as a place to store documents and files. Other than that, you noticed there was nowhere to hide. You waited behind the door, dearly hoping the mice would leave.
1213111.title: The journey to exit the lab

choices: Make it outside without a problem
12131113.content:
As you hugged the wall behind the door desperately, you watched as the shadows for the mice crossed the bottom of the door, creeping under through the light. Your heart was up in your throat, pounding away as the shadows briefly stopped, but thankfully, they moved on.

"Psst."

Looking around, you almost wet yourself in fear that a mouse had been watching you from inside the room and was screwing with you.

"Over here!" The voice said, "We're friends!" Deciding to gamble the odds, you quietly made your way over to the dark corner of the room, your eyes adjusting to eventually see three other cats! A lynx and a mountain lion (both male) you didn't know but did recognize, and a cute female cheetah who was the secretary for the science division, Linda, if memory was correct.

"Dr.?" Linda asked nervously, "W-what happened?"

"Ok first, technician, not a doctor." You said as calmly as possible, "Second, the rodents sabotaged it, and apparently the wolves had the same thing, ended up the same as us." You sit down a dhold your head in your hands, "They're all dead! Dead!" You start quietly sobbing, still having the presence of mind to keep it quiet, but finally being able to talk about the deaths of your coworkers was too much an emotional release.

Linda crouched down and started hugging you, the feeling of bare fur on fur felt odd, but nice, you noted.

"We've got to get out of here." The lynx said, "My platoon should be putting up as much a fight as they can, we just gotta find them and hook up." He looked at you, "Name's Sgt. Blud."

The mountain lion looked over at you, "I'm Dave. The nerd who organized this room."

Nodding, you looked around, "The mice patrols thin the closer you get to the exit, so we can use that to our advantage, but we have to be careful. Once outside, we've got o make for the forest for cover."

Blud nodded, "Makes sense to me, since we can't fight, we hide until we can."

After drying your face, you stood up, and the small group (heh, pun) started their way to the door, looking outside, you didn't see any patrols, and you held Linda's hand as the group ran for the big glass double doors.
12131113.title: You spot a group of cats in the corner of the room

choices: You all escape and make it to the forest
You're spotted on the way out
121311131.content:
With a group effort to push open the glass double doors, all of you managed to make it outside without getting detected. From the steps of the front door you had a clear view of the area surrounding the building. The barracks were to the front, sitting behind a packed parking lot while a road stretched to the left and right. What was alarming was the amount of rodents running about, either working hard to set up their temporary base or herding cats at gunpoint.

Without a word, all of you dashed to the side of the building and hid behind a bush. "Looks like they're making themselves at home," Sgt. Blud growled.

Linda's tail curled around her leg as she groaned. "How are we going to get out?"

That was a good question. Mice and squirrels were everywhere and from the amount of soldiers that were combing through every nook and cranny about the base getting found seemed inevitable. Poking further out from the bush you scanned around for a possible path you all could take but instead your eyes came across something else, a small jeep. It was sitting unattended next to another larger jeep that the cats would normally use, making the rodent-sized vehicle look like a toy car in comparison.

Pointing towards it, you ask the group their opinion about it. "How about we use that?"

"It's unattended," Dave pointed out. "Do you think we can just drive out, though?"

The lynx scratched his whiskers in thought. "It might work, I doubt they're expecting us to simply drive out of here. We can meet up with my platoon in the forest quicker to boot."

Just like that, it was decided. "Let's go," you said.

When the coast was clear, all of you ran as fast as you could to the jeep. Blud hopped in the drivers seat and thankfully whoever left this vehicle unattended forgot to take their keys out. They were still in the ignition. On the back seat, however, was something better. Two loaded assault rifles and a few magazines.

Dave picked one up and looked at it. "Woah. Now we can fight back!"

As he was inspecting it you noticed he was absentmindedly pointing it at you, but thankfully Blud pushed the muzzle up and gave him a stern look. "We'll be needing a lot more of those if we really want to fight back. For now, we have to get out of here."

After getting in the back seat with Linda while Dave took the front passenger seat, Blud wasted no time in started the jeep and driving off. It was nerve-wracking as the lynx took the vehicle through the base at a leisurely pace to not attract attention. Linda herself was shaking and couldn't stop herself from nervously looking at all the rodents they were passing by so you held her hand and gave her a reassuring smile to help calm her down.

That was all you could do right now. You just had to hope they didn't notice that one of their jeeps was packed full of cats.
121311131.title: Make it outside without a problem

choices: You've lost half a leg (knee down, just with one leg)
You've lost half an arm, from elbow down (just on one arm)
1213111312.content:
As the jeep was rolling along, your group saw the perimeter fence up ahead, what looked to be almost half a mile, but you knew was way, way less than that. Linda started to perk up when you heard a massive crack, and the ground next to you exploded in a shower of sparks.

"Eat lead you buck-tooth bastards!" Dave yelled out as he turned around and started unloading his gun into the mice in pursuit of your group.

Linda started screaming, leaning into you and you put yourself between her and the mice' line of sight, giving off bursts of fire from your rifle, simply focusing on staying alive.

A mouse tank, which in terms of caliber was roughly analogous to the standard cat rifle, rolled up and started firing off rounds like a machine gun, which it essentially was.

"Drive Blud, DRIVE!!!" You screamed as a round flew past your face and into the distance, you forced Linda onto the floor of the backseat area and switched to full auto, trying to keep the mice soldiers from getting a good shot with suppressive fire.

"What'd you think I'm doing?!" The sergeant yelled back, not taking his eyes off the gal in the gate up ahead, crouching low to avoid getting shot by a sniper.

"I think we're gonna make it!" Dave cheered, letting out a warcry of victory, before his head exploded.

"Sniper!" You called out, covering Linda with your body, hearing the distant *thump, thump-thump* as Dave's body fell out of the jeep.

As the group reached the fence, the jewel was too wide to make other through the gap, it got wedged, and launched all three of you ito the air, landing roughly on the sandy ground outside the base. You were stunned, and couldn't really move yourself too easily after the impact, you do remember slamming into a piece of the wire fence though...

"C'mon! Move it boy!" Blud yelled out, firing off Dave's rifle overhead, Linda running up to you and covering her mouth in horror. "Bloody hell....grab him and run!" Blud yelled out, putting himself between you and Linda as she half carried, half dragged you to the bushline.

You could vaguely feel pain and numbness at the same time as you entered under the leaves, Blud and Linda screaming at you to stay awake. You were vaguely aware of seeing other shrunken cats, Blud's troops, finding you three before passing out.
1213111312.title: You're spotted on the way out

122.content: The wolf spy, by the name of Cadoc, watch in a nearby location. That takes care of their cannon, its time for me to relay the results of my mission to the leader. Cadoc then proceeded to sneak off the scene...
122.title: Cadoc the spy

1222.content: Upon returning to the base Cadoc immediately headed to the wolf commander,named Otak, and relayed the results of his mission. "Very good, Cadoc. Now ready OUR cannon for fire, remember, we only have one shot at this so we better get it right." an engineer then states. "Sir, we are ready to fire, but we have a 3% chance of failure." "Fire anyway!" "Yes sir!"
1222.title: The wolves' turn

12223.content:
The device spins up, light fills the room and around the down as it readies to fire. Then, rather than spiting light at your enemies, the cats, a blinding light shoots into the sky and forms a sphere. Everyone looks up at the sight and then it falls back to the ground, everything has gone down hill.

The entire city gets smaller and smaller, though it was just this one city. Wolves elsewhere would be unharmed, unless the effects were much more wide-spread than anyone believed. All around the wolves, tree's are getting bigger and bigger, maybe even the grass....

The question know is, where will the ride end?
12223.title: How low can you go?

choices: 1/16th of an Inch Tall (couresty of a ruler in the grass)
122232.content:
As the shrinking seemed to stop, people ventured outside the city to examine just how small they had become. Grass was towering stalked, insects they would normally stepped on were no longer in such a position...

They were pretty dang small....
122232.title: Ants or smaller

1222322.content:
Wolfs flood out of the city in terror as they try and find some place to hide from the army no doubt about to arrive and take care of them. After all, if you went from being bigger than your enemy than being smaller than their toes, you'd probably scatter and wait for help from some unaffected wolves elsewhere.

As Lieutenant Dan ran through the now enormous grass, he stared up in disbelief at it all; there were BUGS bigger than him, much bigger; footprints bigger than him and little remants of society normal-sized that now weighed tons. The wolf came to a sudden and unvoluntary stop as he ran into a huge tower sticking up out of the dirt. It had markings all the way up one side and stretched far taller than the grass as it reached for the sky.

"What the hell" the Lieutenant said as he stared at the structure, then he realized what it was, a ruler. Standing against it he found that if he stretched as far as he could, his ears just barely reached the 1/16 mark and he was tall for a wolf.

Then, out of nowhere there game a thunderous sound of titan footsteps, someone was coming. From here, Dan kept an eye on the 'clearing' ahead of him, a field of no-grass, just mud for whatever approached.
1222322.title: Little Dogs

12223221.content:
Ahead what looked forever away, a wall at least a hundred feet tall slammed into the ground and then another one after it. In front of each one, four enormous spires drilled far into the ground, some creature of enormous power was approaching and fast.

As the creature neared, Dan looked up to see that it was....
12223221.title: Cat

choices: Move towards the nearest wolven village
122232212.content: Only a kitten. Well, as much of an understatement as that is, it seems the wolves are lucky for now. Massive toes rise above their heads as the innocent kitten explores an area he shouldn't even be in. Relieved but still cautious; the wolves move as a group towards the side of the kitten's foot, trying to get out of the way of its next step. No sooner has the last wolf crossed the area in front of the kitten's toe does the massive feline take another step. The wolves are so small that the displaced air from the kitten's movements drag several of them inwards towards the paw-print it made on the ground. Several of them end up stuck in miniature puddles of sweat and musk at the bottom of that paw-print, struggling to clamber their way out while the others climb down into the print to help them. Having survived their first encounter, and after they've rescued their friends, they begin to climb out of the cliff-like footprint to plan their next move.
122232212.title: A kitten

choices: In the two hours, the scientists have "repaired" the device and try it again.
They are still working on it
1222322121.content: Nearly two hours later, Dan and a small group of survivors finally made it to the former military base. It'd been hit the hardest since it was at the center of the accident. The group found it completely by accident. In fact, if Dan hadn't stopped a particularly oblivious coyote, the military base housing the shrinking technology would have been obliterated. The coyote had nearly stepped on the minuscule building. Getting on their knees carefully, Dan and the coyote both looked in wonder at the square base. It was only 1/2 inch long and 1/4 inch tall to the 1/16 inch tall canines! They couldn't see anyone around the base. Maybe everyone was still inside?
1222322121.title: Move towards the nearest wolven village

choices: The wolves are in for a rough time
1222322122.content: Distant pounding becomes a massive, earth-shattering vibrations beneath the wolves feet as many giants start coming their way. Many panic and begin to run, fearing the feline army has come to destroy them. Others attempt to climb the grass to get a better look. In the end, the wolves are nearly trampled to death when the feet of a large number of paws come slamming through. "We'll get you! Where'd he go?" A young, but massive voice sounds above. Looking up from his position next to one massive toe, one of the wolves can see the massive form of another kitten and behind that another, and then another. An entire group of them are in the area and, unfortunately, it seems they're playing a game, "Cat and mouse is no fun when the mouse is another cat" one comments, grumbling as he stomps off in another direction to search, unaware of the speck-like wolves in danger at his very toes.
1222322122.title: Something else comes...

12223221221.content:
The wolves pour out of their tiny city in search of better cover elsewhere, the giant's foosteps created tremors which could shake the city apart. Eventually, about half had fled the city and half remained in the deadly confines. Those who ran, ran into 'caves', climbed grass, made a run at the trees for shelter or one of a million other things.

Going underground wasn't exactly a smart idea, a kitten's toes made huge impressions, well clear of 100 feet deep while walking, not to mention the tonnage of sweat dropped in. If they ran, they'd be tearing at the ground and easily crush a wolf underneath them without ever even realizing it. On top of that, the kitten's claws were larger than any wolf structure and would easily pierce the ground, so even those deep enough to be safe from the pad's wouldn't be safe from claws.

Going up a stalk of grass was potentially the second dumbest idea, not only were you exposed to more force from paws being picked up, but you were more exposed to your environment. Any dirt that flies is gonna hit more grass than ground, any bug that flies is gonna consider the grass an LZ before the ground and being on the grass, your that much closer to a cat for spotting or getting stuck on one of the massive walking mountains.

The trees were the farthest, but safest shelter. A wolf could go inside parts of the massive plant and go up it higher than most kittens. There was one big problem though, the trees were miles away and miles tall; it would take hours to reach what one kitten gets to in ten seconds or so. On top of that, all sorts of now titanic bugs filled the trees and at the upper altitudes the winds would be hurricane force or more.

The only advantage the wolves had was their size made them harder to detect, though any wolf would gladly trade that to be as big as one of those kittenly forces of destruction. Among the few questions now was, could the tiny city be kept hidden?
12223221221.title: The wolves are in for a rough time

122232212211.content:
While the wolves fled the destruction, the kitties kept on playing, wreaking havoc all over that until a few days ago, the wolves would never have noticed. Suddenly, it all took a turn for a wolf worse.

The 'mouse' a dark brown going on black cat was found by a tree. By cat standards, he was the closest thing to a mouse that they had at just over three feet tall for a six year old. The others were closer to the four foot mark, but not quite there, though on the new wolf-scale, four and a half feet was a mile.

The 'mouse' ran across the open grass, trampling numerous of the formerly destructive wolves and unknowlingly bringing others along for the ride on his feet or stuck under them. Then, a cat came from the side and tackled the titan to the ground, things immediately dissolved into a rolling mess across the grass.

In the ground under them, wolves scattered to clear the miles that had now become the kitten's wrestling rink as they devastated a landscape the wolves were just getting used to. Twist that made immeasurably strong bridges were snapped by an instant's force of the fight, craters were dug out all over, towering grass as strong as skyscrapers was felled as easily as toppling a pin; fur, bits of sweat and dirt flung off the fighters forming new obstacles, lakes and in some cases even bridges.

Wolves caught in the battle were helpless as they were either trampled, spared, or found themselves somehow on some part of the massive structures they new as kittens. For the tiny creatures, a single strand of fur towered a hundred feet tall, an arm was a forest of fur. Others with less luck got stuck between the titans' mountainous toes, filled with all sorts of dirt, sweat and things so heavy the wolve's stood no chance against it. Those below of course had less chance of survival. Of course a few wound up either under or in the enormous clothes of the giants, minimal as they were. The last common occurance was to be eaten, a single tooth was anywhere from 50 to 200 hundred feet in length and plenty round, a tongue was a massive laviathon with skyscrapers all its own and the throat was a bottomless tunnel hundreds of feet wide.

Could these massive titan's end this city of wolves in just one little game?
122232212211.title: Rowdy Rough and Titan Tough

122232212212.content:
The presence of cats scared the wolves, let alone kittens with toes that dwarfed any building the city or any city had ever concieved. It was the perfect motivation to fix the shrink-ray and get the city wolves back to full size immediately.

Inside the lab building, every scientist was present and hurredly running wires, hooking in equipment or doing math so complex even the great Sir Isaac Hoonston would be perplexed. There would be one shot at fixing this and one shot only if they lasted long enough, it had long ago been decided there was no time for safety and no chances to be wrong.

When the shrink ray was used, it created a massive light, to the kittens that'd be a little spark, but would surely get their attention if it failed. Of course, by the math, if this failed the wolves would likely end up in a situation where they couldn't hope to defend themselves against anything or even make an attempt at escape.

Finally, it was time to try and fix this, a switch was thrown and the sky filled with a blinding light that would hopefully only effect shrunken objects and not those already full-sized. When the Wolve's vision returned, they found themselves facing....
122232212212.title: Reversal Effects

1222322122121.content:
The wolves opened their eyes to a world doubled in size at the least and possibly even more, it was hard to tell from an angle this low. That last, one and only chance was gone, not that it'd stop another shot at normalcy's return.

Those on lookout high up in the grass, a thousand feet off the ground saw the playing kitten's stop and look towards the light, a little spark to them, possibly from a shiny object. To the tiny canids' horror, the mountains in the distance they'd marked as cats start coming towards them, the damage of each step and quakes amplified seemingly a thousand times or more. It would seem the city was now doomed to either become another mark on a kitten's already dirty foot and pads or become a kitten's tiny toy.

The lead kitten stopped all but right in front of the city, wolves throughout were staring up at the mountain of fur which dwarfed their little city and held the force to destroy it in an instant. The claws menacingly stuck out just short of contacting the ground, showing off their razor sharp tips, sharper than even a wolf-sized knife blade. Specks of blood and some civilization could be seen coating the titanic toes starting at the rim of caked on mud at the pads and going straight on up.

The enormous kitten stood there in search of his shiny prize....
1222322122121.title: A bigger problem

12223221221212.content:
The enormous cat reached down and picked up the entire city on the center pad of his hand. He wasn't quite sure what he was holding, it didn't cover his entire pad and was covered with these little things shooting off the base straight upward. The other cats gathered around as he examined the tiny spectacle started to get drowned in sweat from his palm and all the excitement from their playing.

Down in the city, the wolves looked up at the massive creature that held them all with no effort and then down at the warm black surface their city rested on. Quicker than anyone could react, the city started to take on a salty-liquid, sweat from sweaty palms. Normally this stuff only made a thin layer, so if it was like this, the wolves were a sixty-fourth of an inch tall if that. Now they all wondered what would become of them as they ascended the tallest of their buildings for safety from the flood.

Overhead, the giants argued over who would get to keep the little thing. As they argued, their lead one started walking for home, creating tremors throughout the tiny city with each and every step. Each step moved the city a thousand feet up and down, a minor distance given their twelve thousand foot height off of any sort of ground. It would be interesting to see just what would become of the wolves in the hands of the formerly little kittens.

Meanwhile, all over the cats' bodies, wolves tried to survive the trip to the cat city. The change did help a few, but harmed others. A small group in the seven hundred foot tall titan toes had been pinned by a rock and clump of dirt, the shrink gave them room to get out. Farther up, a group was trying to hang on to the massive fur and avoid falling miles to the ground below; now the fur was far too large for them to even hold onto and it was almost impossible to get on to stay on.
12223221221212.title: In the Hands of Titans

choices: Kitten Growth, two mile tall kids
1222322122122.content:
The wolve's looked around and found they were back to normal size, or at least most of them were, a few wolves and a few posessions were unaffected but they could now be cured later as at the least the city would survive. Formerly massive grass now felt good under barefeet as the wolves looked for others still shrunken.

A few looked at sights they had instants earlier found frightening or enormous, it was like looking back at your kindergarten classroom and how small everything was. Wolves had remarkable memory, so their few hours of sub-insect-size had started to drill in their environment.

Formerly destructive bugs were now no larger than a toe and easily handled with a claw, lakes were easily conquered by a single step or leveled by wiggling toes. Twigs once seen as enormously long and strong bridges of emense weight were now just itty-bitty pieces of wood. Pawprints were now just pawprints again, grass was tiny plant-life and wolves were bigger than kittens.

At least, thats how it went for the most part, a few wolves now feared the paws of their own people as forces of destruction, a wolf cub could now take on a tiny army of shrunken wolves. The little ones often had much to fear as the normal population had no care or caution for the microscopic things all around them.
1222322122122.title: Little Grass, Little Bugs

12223221221221.content:
It is now months after the accidental shrinking incident, the cats have yet to master shrinking but the wolves have made revolutionary strides forward in the field. Warfare is now just starting to take use of the technology, though rescuers have continued to use it in search of yet tiny wolves, some of whom have been trapped as such.

Lieutenant Daniel was among those permenantly small, at least as far as science had lead them. He was among somewhere around half the wolf population in similar situations, either still tiny but saveable or tiny for good. Perhaps though, the worst part was that the final effort to correct the situation had shrunken anyone who hadn't grown to about a 32nd of an inch tall. Those who'd been found in this condition were partnered up with someone to help them along in the comparatively enormous city.

"Come on lil' bro, wake up" Tom said, the younger but now far larger brother of Dan. He was charged with carrying for 'lil' bro' despite his young age of just barely...
12223221221221.title: Refined Resizing

choices: Finding little people in the woods
122232212212211.content:
Tommy was a twelve year old wolf and stood all of ten thousand feet tall to a little wolf. It had been an intimidating sight at first, but by now most tinys around giants had gotten used to these sorts of sights. This was just one more thing that had grown into another part of every-day life, though there was still fear, just fear people had gotten used to.

The little wolf, on a bed of his own on the floor slept away, despite his brother's booming voice trying to wake him up. Then the titan banged a toe against the wooden ground by Dan's bed and it shook things more than enough for the little Lieutenant to wake up. He came to on the floor after the earthquake had thrown him several feet from his bed, in a 'safety corner.' Every tiny wolf had a small corner rigged to be free of vibrations from the rest of the house and be in a relatively safe spot, so this meant that someone had just stepped on his little area.

"Come on, lets go" Tom boomed, "you know we've got a lot to do today."

Dan stared up at his 'little' brother's mud-caked toes, it was one of the things that annoyed him the most. Everytime he got stepped on, he got covered in that dirt coating Tom's pads, claws and the space between his toes and even covering a decent amount of fur. At this size, most of that looped far overhead anyway; on a flat surface a pad was 1/4 inch or fifty feet tall before it went to fur for a good three or four hundred feet until the top of the toes. Of course, on top of that, it stank, especially all the sweat from the pads and it only increased as the kid grew each day.

"Come on, get up little foot" Tom prodded, a joke going back to the early days of being partnered. Dan had yelled at Tom a lot to watch what he did with his big feet and now that had gotten turned around on the smaller wolf. He continued to look down, through a special optical lens and sound amplifier built to help the partner's find their smaller friends and see them in excellent clarity.

Dan sat up and held his right foot, remembering how he used to have to look out for stepping on his little brother's little feet around the house. In a wolf's young days, their feet aren't rough and therfore easily hurt. Reluctantly he got up, got dressed and came back ready to go, ascending a massive screw that was used as his 'pick up' point.

Tom held a hand down and Dan boarded the tip of the claw to be dropped into his brother's forest of fur around his shoulders. It was a bumpy ride, but at least the fur often held off the wind of the high-speed movement. The instant 'little foot' was down, the giant wolf took off at a fast jog towards and then out the door towards the duo's work with the SCO, Size Central Operations.

Sitting on his perch, Dan waited until they had reached his now military-ordered job, much as he'd rather stick to special operations. He felt his brother's massive muscles moving under the skin and bobbed up and down with them as they easily moved his almost zero weight.

Onward to work...
122232212212211.title: Pre-teen titan

1222322122122111.content:
It seemed to have been ages since the event, but still effected people were missing in the woods. Of course, these people also had miles of land to travel just to see the edge of the city, so it wasn't the easiest thing to find help. Among the many things in the orders of Dan and Tom was to go out and find these people. Of course it was always easier said than done.

On Tom's shoulder, Dan sat waiting for word he'd spotted something. The pre-teen titan was the only one who could spot the creatures as the smaller one's eyes weren't good enough at this distance and on the little lupine's scale it'd take days to cover the same empty ground that the giant made in minutes. On his scale, the little one had a 2-3ft stride, the enormous brother had a 7200ft stride.

Tom found himself amidst something strange, it took him a seeming eternity to notice it. He just dumped off a couple tons of sweat and dirt in a city, but the thing was, the biggest sky scraper came to over two feet over him. To a tiny, that is a very large height, in the many thousands of feet, up to the miles scale. Below, each foot had knocked out a series of smaller buildings as each toe splayed and eventually took its own two blocks.
1222322122122111.title: Finding little people in the woods

1222322122122112.content:
In this job, there was no clock in clock out, it was military managed and payment went by the day and by successful reports coming back to command, it really made it hard to get a decent pay-check unless you were of officer rank. So, twenty-four hours and seven days on duty, Tom headed right for today's assignment; contact with a colony of tiny's outside the city. This group had decided they were safest as far from civilization as they could get.

Tom continued his jog out of the city and into the woods for a while until he came to a tree surrounded by a small ditch and with a thin, narrow pipe running down from its top. The giant stopped right in front of the pipe and put a hand up to let Dan down on the ground, the pipe was an elevator and supply line to the top and bottom of the tree, it connected several cities in the colony running from underground to the top. For today, that was the way of making contact with the steadily growing group.

Dan stepped onto the claw and held tight as he was taken to the ground and then jumped down into the hills of dirt and mud between him and the pipe. Being a tiny speck, a single piece of dirt was an obstacle, but eventually he reached an path beaten down an eighth of an inch that lead to the pipe a short distance away. It would take him a bit of walking to get there, but he'd get there eventually.

Meanwhile, titan Tom would get all the fun of sitting around and doing nothing, aka sitting around on one's rear end with a thumb up it. There was a portable shrink-ray, but it wasn't used very often, it was scary being small and he did like being smaller than Dan. After he say the tiny trooper enter the tube, he sat down leaning against the tree in the afternoon shade.

"This is the most boring job ever"
1222322122122112.title: Tiny Colony Contact

122232212212212.content:
The voice of a six year old boomed down from some eleven thousand feet overhead, it was a loud boom that would have shattered any tiny wolf's ear drums save for the latest in technology to dampen the noises of the world. A seemingly harmless sound like even a pin dropping was almost complete bass and deafening to a little wolf, their ears already ultra sensitive just for their species connections. Ears being much smaller only made it worse. The sight of a titan from down herewas perhaps the only thing that could touch the sound.

Daniel was on a bed in a marked off section of the floor reserved for him and such that none of the giants were supposed to come in. He opened his eyes to 500 feet or so of his "little" brother's toes as a mountain range overhead. They were coated in mud and dirt, which only made things worse for a tiny creature. At this size, the smell a normal wolf could easily ignore despite a sensitive nose was over-powering as it hardly seemed to drop over-range. This was a problem numerous times after having been stepped on, one was nothing but the mud, dirt and sweat from paws, toes and the immense pads. Rather than face another day of that, the LIeutenant closed his eyes and pretended to sleep. Until the titan got out his site-scope, he'd never know.

Impatient, Tom slammed a toe against the ground inside the safety area, which created an Earthquake nothing could've slept through and launched the 'big' brother clear out of the bed and perhaps as far as 100 feet in the air. Once he landed, he quickly got ready for the day's problems and tortures of his reduced stature. In minutes he'd reached a another marked area for pickup and ascended onto the tip of Tom's claw, which felt more like a flying piece of countryside. In minutes, the mach-speed flight ended at the forest of fur by an enormous ear. The huge space came to a tip around 750 feet overhead and seemed to go on unendingly into the wolf's head. Dan proabably could fit all the way in and come out the other side.

"Ok lil' bro, ready!" Tom said, seemingly running forward and making a hurican grade blast of wind wash through his fur. It felt good to him while the 32nd of an inch tall wolf felt like he was going to be blown clear off. In reality, the kid was just walking to the door.
122232212212212.title: Really Big "lil'" bro

1222322122122121.content:
The 'little' brother worked as a dock boy. Before the shrinking, this would not have worked, however, following it the war of the species took many odd turns, among them some cities being blasted and stuck small like the few wolves from earlier in. This city was one of them, blasted by an altered ray of the cats, wolf efforts to restore it had failed.

Neurobia, one of the first great casualties of the war was now perched in a tree along the border with the cats, used as a recon post like all the other shrunken cities.
