Smaller shrunken cities and villages were in the area as well, relying on this one for supplies, hence the need of dockboys. The entirety of the city may well have been just an inch long, but the main area was a quarter of that.

Various 'small' creatures filled the woods, but were on the wolf's side as they were not the prey of wolves, but of cats. These creatures carried supplies to the distribution cities, its not like they had a large load to carry out, especially when the thing they supplied was smaller than the things they ate.

This is where dockboys came in. The incredibly tiny size of these wolves allowed them to build functional hover-craft using magnets. The craft often did not land but tethered and mounted to docks floating with the same technology. Out there, dockboys used a form of jetpack to fly about and bring ships in with incredible presicion.

Dan, far too small to move anything off his scale, played an interesting roll. He kept his brother on task, kept track of radio calls and listened for anything the people might hide from the government. Lastly, he was to keep an eye out for cats of similar scale infiltrating.

Today, the first job was...
1222322122122121.title: Dock Boy

12223221221222.content:
A sudden earthquake rocked the city, then a hundred more in rapid succession. Then the entire area was suddenly drowned in shady from several massive objects towering into the sky. Two columns started at the ground, met in the sky and continued up and then two more came off at the sides ending in five titanic spires each.

The Kittens had grown! The 'little' kids stretched into the sky and no knew it, but not why. Trees that had once towered over them were now shorter than a single pad. Immediately they started searching for the source of their sudden titanly status, two of the giants had back-packs on and dropped them to the ground, leveling a mile of forest and creating a massive depression. Miles of ground were covered in a few steps as they tried to close in on a light they'd seen just before this happened.

On the ground, wolves reverted to fleeing for some sort of cover, but now there was a lot less that they could do. Most of them ran for the woods or to caves they knew of in the area, afterall the cats were big but there's no way they could crush a rock like those of a cave, right? The last group stayed in the city, arming up or working on the shrink ray to blast the kittens down to size.

Of course for those still tiny, doom was the only likely occurance; they were too small to be seen by the feline giants and could still be easily killed by them, their own people and bugs. Many were already being killed under their own people's massive paws or surviving on them as best they can. A unique few were working with their 'normal' sized friends to survive the gigantic wolves and felinoid continents.

Lieutenant Dan was among those trapped tiny, to add insult to injury, the act that had fixed the other wolves had left the small ones gradually shrinking. At the moment he was trying to reach his house, which he shared with his little brother, hoping he'd find him alright and that he'd even get there alive.

The streets were filled with the massive feet of wolves running everywhere and it was just about impossible to dodge them all, hard to believe that earlier today he could have knocked em' flat with a single kick and now he couldn't stop them with anything and whatever he did felt like hitting a solid wall. The massive toes, claws, and pads were all covered with caked on and even wet mud and dirt of all sorts, even a few stains of blood or remnants of the city that hadn't grown.

Finally, one came along that Dan couldn't dodge, a larger than life five year old. His feet were walking piles of mud and sweat, he stomped down and the Lieutenant was stuck to the dirt between his toes as he ran. The massive creature continued on, unknowing of his passenger below. At least he was headed in the general direction of the troop's house and covering miles every few minutes.

The Lieutenant struggled to free himself from the sticky and slimy gunk around him, his view ahead consisted of massive mountains on either side with enough strength to hurl him into the stars without a thought. He fought more each instant, knowing he was getting smaller and weaker by the second, at last he got free and found himself clinging to a 'pebble' just in front of his last prison, to avoid being hurtled into the sky and certain death.

The titan leaped thousands of feet in the air, came to a stop and suddenly Dan was standing on the wall of slime he'd been in minutes ago. It seemed his shrinking had slowed, but his pawprint in the wall was now bigger than his head. The world twisted as the foot was brought up towards the kid's head, blood oozing from the toe little Dan was clinging to. Massive walls moved in as the kid tried to squeeze the pain of a deep cut away, luckily the tiny trooper survived, but barely.

Like all wounds, the cut began to itch and Dan found an immense spire and wall of dirt coming at him, seconds later he was climbing down from a mountain of dirt and mud on the ground. He looked around and saw what appeared to be his house not far away, a titan sitting on the front step seeming clearly upset about something. A massive, furry tail was on the ground and made a potential bridge up.
12223221221222.title: Kitten Growth, two mile tall kids

122232212212221.content:
There wasn't much choice at this point, it looked like home, it had better be home. Otherwise he was going to be breaking and entering, possibly get killed and really be in trouble as if this wasn't home, where was it? Screw the questions, its time for some action.

Dan ran up to the massive jungle vines of fur and started climbing in the hopes it was Tom or at least someone helpful. From here he saw that the fur was the right color and pattern, but there weren't too many ways to be sure when you were a spec smaller than most known bugs. So, he jumped up at the fur, but the tip of the tail was just off the ground to tease the little wolf about his height.

He started to build a mound of dirt up towards the tail. It probably would not be wise to question where it came from though, just as long as it got the job done. At last, he jumped, reached, and started to climb a strand of hair thicker around than most buildings and far taller.

Suddenly, the strand of fur rocked, shook and vibrated with a massive force, Dan had to stop and hold on for his very life to avoid the couple hundred foot drop to the ground. Dan looked down and saw an ant putting its second leg onto another piece of fur and it all shook again. As the creature pulled itself all the way on, its last leg on the ground leveled the dirt pile, which was just about as big as Dan.

Each step of the creature rocked the fur and when it was right on Dan he could see it was far, far larger than he was; one of its legs was thicker than he was tall. The millions of hairs on it were longer than Dan and spaced farther apart than he was tall, as it stepped over him, he saw its armor was also thicker than a tank's. Thinking quickly, he jumped on and started to scale the creatures legs as it moved, once on its back it was clear that this thing could have carried his whole street and probably much more. On its back, he clung onto that giant hair as a handhold so he didn't fall in the vertical climb, and bit by bit he worked his way towards the head where he would bet he was safest.
122232212212221.title: Macro-sects

122232212212222.content:
Elsewhere, the city remained in peril as the mountains closed in and as the chaotic effects of the shrink ray continued to be felt; even after it had partially worked, it was creating other problems. Could these problems be beneficiary?

A tiny pack of cubs was cornered just outside the city, some normal sized kids had decided to terrorize the band of girls and boys who'd united to get through this. They retreated as a massive toe just missed turning them into microscopic bloodstains amongs a black, brown and red wall of many more. The kids were backed into a corner and now drenched in the dirt and sweat of a pad that had just missed them. Their corner was a massive tree that they could not hope to scale.

"Come on!" one tiny said, turning and making a best-speed run up the tree, spurred on the others followed, after fifteen minutes of going unharmed, they reached about as high up a 'normal's' step. One of the tormentors stepped up to climb the tree, aiming for the fleeing kids. "Hey, I can climb trees too!" he said, before wiping all the mud he could on the tree and jumping down.

Just as the wolf hit the ground, a bright light came off the point on the tree where his foot had been. The 'little' wolves were getting big and as they grew, the bullies shrunk. The new giants grabbed the shrinking wolves as they traded places to extreme opposites, by the time they were outgrowing the trees, the little bullies weres pecks on their padded hands. They kept their hands flat level to keep their prize, but had to step back several times to avoid flattening the city.

When they had at last finished, they were on the same scale as the kittens but of course were taller as wolves were typically bigger than cats. They collectively looked towards the city and barely saw it, a single toe would level it.
122232212212222.title: Little Titans

1222322122122221.content:
The tables had just turned on the bullies, they were each standing on a black pad of a formerly tiny wolf and at that were just about on the cellular scale. For each of the tiny wolves, a giant was more closely related to a continent or a planet in terms of size, though from their point of view, they couldn't see anything but black wall; the fingerprint grooves of pads, which to the tinies were miles wide, miles tall and infinitely long.

As the bullies finished shrinking, they looked around at a world of cells, round and black objects that were roughly their size, but some were bigger. This put them somewhere between bacteria and virus, neither of which would survive inside the body for very long anyway. Of course, the tiny creatures didn't stand much chance on the outside either, especially in the pads.

Rick Ridowy, the head bully was walking around his new prison, round black things making squishing sounds every time his little feet walked over them. He wanted, badly wanted to kick or hit something but was still quite a difference from the walls and the last object he'd passed was a normal bug, which had nearly trampled him. He eventually did reach the wall and immediately began kicking it, but suceeded in only injuring his microscopic pads, once stern enough to break solid cinderblocks and legs in martial arts classes, now they couldn't harm a fly; though a fly could finish him and never even sea the blood splatter.

There was a sudden roar coming from far down the immense passageway, Rick looked and saw a tsuanmi of sweat coming his way, miles tall. At the center of it was a charm anklet he had stolen as a piece of good luck. He looked down at his toes and saw no sign of the anklet there. The immense piece of leather was his first act of bullying today and then he realized he'd taken it from this very kid.

[Flash Back]

During the return to normalcy, the bullies were right next to the now titanic, formerly bullied. As he had grown, Rick bent down and took the object from the current titan, the object had grown just enough to fit on the tip of one of his claws. One of the things he'd been taught was that for a bully to take something from a permanent victim was a measure of good luck, a connection to them. It was silly of course, but he'd played along just to test it out. The rotten thing must have come off when he shrank.

[Present]

As the ring closed in, it was apparent that it clearly dwarfed the wolf city, at least if it was on Rick's level. As it closed the miles, he found he was clearly smaller than most tiny wolves and that he was missing a claw. He looked up to see his own, mud caked, torn up, rough claw right behind the titanic ring and still sized to fit in like a glove. That massive spire had earlier formed a wall for the now titanic and killed two of them, right through the chest.

The claw and ring closed in, Rick found himself drowning in sweat at about the center of the band before his claw approached and through in his own victims blood, pinning him against the tiny, formerly toe-size ring with a force found nowhere else in the universe.

A while later, the flood had leveled out to become an ocean instead. Rick was still pinned and the ring stood upright, holding him just above the flood waters. He hacked up salty sweat, gallons of dirt some of which was from his own body, and plenty of blood from his victims; at present height those bloodstains themselves were of giants.

Miles overhead, maybe something bigger, Jack, the leader looked down at his paw pad along with the others in their group, unknowing of the challenges the bullies were facing. What he did know was that they were better off without these bullies still around, so he put his hand to his mouth, licked and sucked as hard as he could to ensure the bullie would meet a demise. The other titans followed suit, though they wished they could see their bullies to give them some of the torture they deserved.

In Jack's mouth, the ring and claw remained as they were, passing through as specs against the teeth and tongue of the enormous wolf. Rick took in gallons of saliva, but managed to get enough air to stay alive. Meanwhile, Jack's massive lungs had no problem surviving and the worst he tasted was a 'little' dirt and a 'little' sweat.
1222322122122221.title: Revenge and Ironies

12223221221222212.content:
The dogs turned as one man on the cats, dropping to a sort of all fours stance to attack. Their feet dug into the ground pushing around tons of dirt like it was a bit of rocks in a greased pan. Tree's were mowed over like nothing, claws dug in deep, and then before the cats had a second to react, the canines charged.

Miles of ground were covered and several canines and felines in the woods wound up on the giants in someway or another. The normal and tiny people were nothing to the macroscopic wolves at the moment, their city was at stake. Even if a single pad could level the city and leave no trace of it, it was still gonna get the best defense they could bring to bare.

The cats turned just in time to see the dogs coming, but not react. The wolves tackled and miles of forest were obliterated by the enormous back's of the titans, their shoulders dug trenches down deep enough to form lakes. Soon the fight broke up into a bunch of 'smaller' ones as each wolf took on a cat, trading shots in the force of mega tons. Tsunamis of blood, huricanes of fur, and claws flew off of everyone in the fight as blow was traded for blow.

At one point, a cat was right at the city, his toes made a huge crater right in front of the city; a single twitch would take out the entire place. Down in the city, the little lupines were staring up at the foot and mostly a single toe of a cat cub who earlier would've easily been handled by any wolf. No one could see much past the tops of the toe, not even to the ankle or part way there.

Seconds later the enormous foot was sent skyward as the cat flew backward. At the opposite end of the city a narrower, but taller paw of a cub was stretching skyward. As the wolf walked past the city, a few pieces of fur fell and nearly toppled several skyscrapers, but luckily did not. As the fight wore on, the land around the city was torn up, fur flew, and the ground shook with force that defied all scales of measurement.
12223221221222212.title: Fight's on!

122232212212222121.content:
In the city, the view of a toe and attatched claw bigger than the city was all the catalyst it took to bring the scientists back to fullspeed in the effort to correct the size-struggle filling the area. Genes were extracted from fallen fur to target just the cats for now and then cut them down a bit. It would be next to impossible to get a lock on anything with the laser, it could only move so much, so it'd be a widespread shot.

With the cats close to the city and a single wolf standing almost directly over the tiny wolves, the scientists were ready. The other titans were closer to the cats to hold them off while that one in back was the last line of defense until things went offensive again. Less than a step in front of the city, the defending wolf was backlit by a huge blue pulse, it blinded everyone, even those looking away from it.

When everyone's vision returned....
122232212212222121.title: Scientists Intervene

1222322122122221211.content:
When the wolves could see again, they saw the world starting to expand around them, though at the least it was gradual. The cats all stepped forward to get a good look at the threat diminishing by the second as they soon became the supreme power of the world. The only thing to oppose them now was the scientists.

First, however, the shrinking lupines had to be handled. The wolves were around chest level with their counterparts and getting lower by the second. Soon they were craning their necks up to see the heads of their foes and struggling to come up with some strategy to win this fight, even when they were quite clearly at a massive disadvantage. Most of the wolves though were frozen in fear at the strength of their enemies.

One wolf ran forward and leapt at the outstretched arm of his opponent, trying to bring him down. The cat didn't budge and soon the dog was standing on top of the cats arm and bit by bit coming to be surrounded by fur. He was about normal size now and smaller than a single muscle of his enemy, he had no chance of winning this war.

Two cats reached down and picked up their shrinking 'friends', pulling them out of their own footprints while they were still big enough to even be seen. The wolves were stored somewhere safe on the cats' person, in wrinkled pad or pocket, from their perspective it was really hard to tell as both were surrounded by black-walled pads as they were moved. The last of the little lupine group son found themselves swimming in lakes of their own sweat, in their own footprints; the gaps between where their toes had been looked like little mountains and the walls of the craters were impossibly high, it was hard to believe this was all caused by their very presence.

As the wolves floated there, a few felt sharp pokes at their feet and moved around to look. Some trees, now the smaller than ordinary thorns had managed to get worked around and poke the little wolf cubs. So, anything they'd been in contact with while shrinking had shrunken with them, even all the wolves that'd been stuck on them. But one thing seemed out of place, the trees appeared even smaller than when the wolves were giants, then it hit them; they'd continued to grow, so the cats were still growing.

The remaining cats looked down at the impressions in front of them, now not even as deep as a pad and shriveling each instant....
1222322122122221211.title: Shrunken Heroes

1222322122122221212.content:
The light had scored a full-force hit on the cats, bit by bit the diminished in stature while even to the world the wolf cubs grew at a remarkable pace. Within minutes the cats were looking up to see the wolve's arms and chest where they had at least been eye level.

By the time they were moused sized to the wolves, the remants of their giant footprints could be crushed under a wolf cub toe. That it would be fun to keep them mouse sized flooded all the wolves minds, even though their mouse was a normal persons giant. A handful of the cats turned to run, but found their tails pinned under the razor sharp toe claws of the lupines. Here something odd happened, these cats stopped shrinking, the others continued until their attempted escapes and capture except for four.

The four totally normal sized had been frozen, they found themselves standing in their own enormous paw-prints, walled in on all sides by dirt that had taken a tremendous ammount of force to move. They also found themselves in lakes of sweat, unshrunken and left from their own pads. As they floated their soaked, somewhere or another on their feet they felt a stabbing sensation, taking a look they found whatever was on them had shrunken with them, including potentially millions of lupines, trees and tiny structures. All they had to do was get out of here.

That would be easier said than done, their wolfen "friends" stood miles tall overhead, capable of leveling this whole trench just by wiggling their toes or even just flexing them.
1222322122122221212.title: Little Villains

12223221221222212121.content:
The wolves lifted their feet and let the mouse-sized cats go for now, though it was clear that going too far would mean becoming dog-food in an instant. Those cats roamed off in search of their normal sized friends and the large lupines turned in search of their city and any new threats to arise.

The mouse-cats found their friends, still in their paw prints and dripping wet but at least on some dry 'mountains' they had found. When the big cats approached their friends, they found they were still lesser than bugs in size, heck the paw prints were barely a step down. This was a load of irony, the small ones were breeds of tigers, panthers and other big cats, the mice were forms of Lynx, though they had full-length tails.

One of the crueler cats, or at least one spoiling for vengance on the larger ones approached one of his normal friends and just for size comparisons, dug a ring in the dirt with a single toe-claw around the little cat. The tiny tiger just saw a wall of dirt spring up around him and didn't see much method of escape from it. Large lynx watched, and after irritating boredom took a swipe at the dirt with his tail, nearly crushing the tiger.

In other places, the cats gave their friends in aid in escaping the craters and lakes. As far as lakes went, the wetness didn't even reach fur when they stood in the puddles. Most of the tiny tigers and puny panthers stayed with their friends, in forests of fur around the shoulders, ears and head. There they enjoyed their tiny captives and held on as the tiny captives of titan friends.
12223221221222212121.title: Aided Escape

12223221221222212122.content:
The fewer cats, the better. The wolves each stepped over to a foot print trapping a normal sized cat and potentially millions of wolves trapped on those cats in sizes so small they couldn't hope to be found by a giant and likely would not end up being fixed any time soon.

Each of the wolves just brought a foot by the little marks in the dirt and pushed their toes into it, widening and lengthening the crater and assuredly ending the felines. The little kittens were eclipsed in darkness and saw only wrinkled black when they looked up. Then the black thing slammed down, up, and down again, moving about and sending tremors through the ground as they unleashed a force unequaled across the globe.

For the dogs it was like squishing a bug they couldn't see, so small there wouldn't even be a stain on their pads. The microscopic wolves on the cats though might survive, at their size they were like dust and could float away with the dirt. Even for the few of them to go, it was a small price given they would likely be trapped or tortured anyway, an insufferable indignity.
12223221221222212122.title: No tiny cats

12223222.content:
Ahead what looked forever away, a wall at least a hundred feet tall slammed into the ground and then another one after it. In front of each one, four enormous spires drilled far into the ground, some creature of enormous power was approaching and fast.

As the creature neared, Dan looked up to see that it was....
12223222.title: Wolf

122232222.content:
The titanous foot belonged to a 'little' kid! The wolf cub couldn't have been any older than five and more than likely was four or somewhere in between. The kid stretched skyward well over half a mile to 3,600ft tall, despite that he would normally be just 38 inches tall.

As the spire-claw toes neared, Dan recognized this giant, it was his "little" brother, Tom! The twerp must have been out playing with his friends, probably those low-life humans; the species that'd been holding the wolves and cats back from all out war.

A footstep later, the Lieutenant was shaken out of his thought as Tom's immense wait shook the ground enough to launch him into the air and onto the foot. "Nowhere to go but up" Dan said, moving through the forest of fur for his brother's head, from down here there was no way he'd be heard; otherwise the kid would've noticed everyone else's screams of terror.

It was an odd experience to go through your own brother's fur, the kid who had been half your hieght and now had 50ft. tall fur on your scale. Then, suddenly rather than climbing up from branch of fur to branch of fur, the Lieutenant found himself walking as the giant laid down against a tree not too far from the city. The kid had nearly stepped on it, but likely stepped over it; the whole place would barely be larger than one or two of his toes.

However, he had seen other giants in the distance, perhaps on the same mission as Tom, find home. From here he couldn't make out who they were, how old, how big or even what species. There was no time for that now, just moving onward, despite the shaking from just sitting down.

The sudden drop no doubt shook the city, it certainly did a good job with Dan. He was glad though that he was now walking across the giant's stomach, despite its up and down moving making it hard to walk. A bit later things moved up hill again as he was forced to climb the enormous chest, a single muscle dwarfed him, the city and about everything on an exponential scale.

Tom felt an insect or something crawling along his bare-chest, he looked down but couldn't see anything under his fur. Dan however, saw sharp teeth that could finish a city in a bite and the mouth of a predator...
122232222.title: Little Brother

1222322221.content:
Dan continued along on the uphill trek for a bit until it became flat and ended at a massive column going upward, Tom's neck. From the looks of things, the Lieutenant had come to his brother's stripes, a trait heavily present in the family where two white stripes go up either side of the neck and head and up to the ears. For Tom, the white marks were about two inches apart, for Dan, they were just about wide enough to host a football game.

"Nowhere to go but up" the wolf said to himself, jumping up onto a strand of fur that arched up and back. On it he walked up and took a leap at another strand, and another, and another. "And I always said he had short fur."

At four inches, or just shy of four hundred feet up, the titan turned his head. The former big brother hung on, claws into fur, to avoid falling off in the eight-G movement. "AHHH!" Dan yelled, as he was flung to the edge, dangling over the side.

"Huh?" Tom said, his voice a massive deep boom, as he turned towards some infinitely tiny sound he'd heard. It was a shriek that seemed to have some sort of vocal pattern to it, but it was so quiet, it almost seemed impossible to have existed.
1222322221.title: Little voices

1222322222.content: Dan paused as the Titan started to move, he climbed up a stalk of fur to see just what it was that was coming, it could be good, it could be bad or it just might be something way in between...
1222322222.title: Two or more Titans

12223222221.content:
"There you are Tom!" An infinitely loud girl's voice said, despite its pitch, it was still deep to Dan's ears as he looked for the titan's approach, wherever she was. "So this is where my boyfriend has gotten off to."

Now, that, didn't make sense. Tom had never had a girlfriend, he had lots of friends and a few were female, but none had declared themselves his girlfriend. Of course, lately the young wolf had been hanging out with people outside the main city, where Dan, wouldn't be able to find out much.

The Lieutenant knew about must of the going's on inside the city and of the school's, he had a few teachers whom he kept in touch with, so it wasn't too hard to keep up. As far as he knew, things in that now tiny city hadn't involved any love for Tommy at all...
12223222221.title: Girl Friend

122232222212.content:
The girlfriend closed in fast, now at this size, Dan's vision wasn't so good as the water in the air was that much larger and that much better at blocking light. It was almost as bad as trying to see through the clouds, but really the visibility was about the same to scale, about a mile to the tiny wolf.

Then, suddenly, Tom's whole body shook as a massive wall of pink mountains slammed down on it, just missing Dan. There were five mountains, getting bigger from one side to the other, facing them, the 'small' one was all the way to the left and the largest on the right. They were coated in dirt at places and dripped water colored by some of this dirt, in lakes and oceans.

"Little forceful today, aren't you Arin?" Tom boomed, as he tried to keep from sinking any lower to the ground from the force his human girlfriend was putting on him. He weighed more, but she was just a bit taller with oddly more control of her center of gravity, which about now was not too far from Dan.

"Aw, come on big pup," the girl replied, scheming to hug the dog either where he was, or try to pick him up...
122232222212.title: Cross-species

1222322222122.content:
In the distant city, work was going on to reverse the current size problem, and hopefully only effect those shrunken rather than grow the wolves and anything near-by. The scientists hurredly made calculations, hooked up new equipment, made observervations and pulled of about a million smaller tasks to fix their mess. At last the work was done and they threw the switch.

A blinding light filled the sky and area all around, Arin was blinded and her sweaty foot slipped on the smooth, clean fur of Tom's chest. As the titaness went down, her foot went up to snare the blinded Dan between her massive toes. Tom, with his eyes closed was the only one not blinded, he had been 'puckering up' to kiss Arin, she'd pulled stunts like this at every meeting. He wound up licking her foot and nearly eating his brother, though Dan was thoroughly drenched in a mix of sweat and saliva.

Standing on a massive 'pebble', he looked up and something didn't seem right, he looked out through the massive walls on either side and realized Tom was now just a fuzzy blur. He looked at the gunk all around him and saw a massive footprint, at least as big as his own house back in the suburbs of the city, it was his and he had been shrunken even more. The wolves were half their former height and the titans were still just as big.
1222322222122.title: Scientific Slip-up

choices: Someone makes it to the scene before the wolves...
The wolves know exactly what happened and are immediately on the scene.
13.content: Everything is growing, it's only moments before everyone realizes what happened... Somehow the cannon mistook wolves for felines (Go figure) and now the entirety of the feline village is reducing in size. Like a beacon the sky is filled with a blue light and those of the lupine village spot it. It's only a matter of time before the new rulers of the feline kingdom find their way to the now small population of cats.
13.title: Cannon fired but.. Why is everythng getting big...

131.content:
The wolf armies and officials took their time, the village with the shrink ray had been picked for a very strategic reason; it was surrounded by civilians from both sides. In particular, a summer camp just to the north had both wolf and cat cubs who would no doubt be storming towards the all but microscopic felines by now.

Standing guard over them, there was a small wolf spec ops team that had been on permanent station, just to make sure the feindish felines could never get away with any attacks there. It just wouldn't have flown, and now there were advance scouts to A. Guard the kids B. Make sure it was safe and C. provide front-line first response recon.
131.title: Local Defense goes offensive

1311.content:
The shrink ray had stretched out farther than most people realized, its effects spreading through the woods and having effects on all different parts of the summer camp. Not all of it was hit, but large chunks and the ray hit both cats and dogs, making it so that in the end it was poor aim and not poor design that did the cats in.

Towards the front, both cats and wolves were scrambling over pebbles the size of small mountains and hills, goofing off and playing like all kids do. It was all part of the experience, they thought it was normal to suddenly look up at pebbles formerly smaller than the tips of their toe-nails as mountains. So, claws clanged as barefoot kids climbed all over tiny obstacles having a blast. Not even sharp edges were anything to be feared, aside from the fact that the edges were a lot duller now, wolf and cat cubs didn't have shoes, as for lupine and feline alike they weren't made.

Deeper into the place, Canids and Felines appeared to have become country-sized, at least to the shrunken ones. They'd just seen their friends suddenly shrivel right in front of them and were watching their every step, crawling on the ground looking for the itty-bitty-people. They weren't quite sure if this was a new game, if their friends had disappeared or what. A few had started to stomp around, but were quickly stopped and a most just looked around in confusion.

Throughout the place, lupine troops were on both sides of the fence, both shrunken and normal sized; in the dark. Lieutenant Dan Dean was among the shrunken ones, he had been standing on a stone path when suddenly the bunch of kids just a few meters ahead of him seemed to get bigger. That of course, couldn't have been, the other kids not five steps away were still just as short as a second ago.

He walked closer, and the closer he got, the bigger the distance seemed to get. When he stopped, he was on a stone over 100 meters up and ahead of him, fur-filled titans took up his view. A tigress's toes spread out on his right with pink painted spires making mine shafts in the ground and on the left a rather large lupine blocked out the sun with the tip of his claws. Elsewhere, all around, miniatures of each were scrambling over the rocks, through the dirt and everywhere else playing, a few were even scrambling up the titan's toes and onto their bodily forests of fur.
1311.title: Mixed Results

13112.content:
Looking up, the formerly nameless Wolf finally had been id'd, it was Tom! Dan's 'little' brother, one of the reasons he'd taken this post here and done so much to ensure he'd get it, to defend the lil' bro. Of course, now, lil' bro wasn't so little anymore and there wasn't so much Dan could do to defend him given that anything big enough to threaten Tom could finish Dan off with a simple twitch.

Suddenly, the titan bent down and was on all fours, sniffing and searching the ground for his now all but microscopic friends. His breathing and sniffing though was creating winds that'd put the strongest of hurricanes and storms to shame, leaving Dan and others to cling on to whatever was round them.

Dan looked up at the spire-scaled teeth, enormous nasel passages, and monumental power that hung over him. Minutes ago, that was a little head, small nose and lots of baby's teeth, or at least comparatively. Hard to believe he had thrown that kid, beaten him up and scared him out of his fur, right now the tables were turned. If Tom tried any of that, well, anything this small wouldn't survive, that was for sure.

Suddenly, the ground rocked and rolled with some massive force, yet the stones didn't seem to so much as move a nanometer, Dan's little pads under his tiny feet still felt the movement just before he was sent to the ground. Well, wound up flat on his face on the stone. Off in the distance he saw a huge, white blur followed by an orange blur and many others shooting across the ground behind Tom. As they shot by, a gust beyond all gusts sweapt through along the explosions of impacts and collisions that'd deafen anyone.

Whatever it was, it got Dan's attention, he stood up, turned around to look and then turned back for just a second to step forward. The movement seemed to show off a want to stay and look, but a powerful urge to follow the action; moving away was like trying to resist the urge.

For Dan, it set him with a better idea of his and Tom's size, and showed one place where he didn't want to end up, under Tom's pads. The couple steps rattled Dan's bones to their cores and scared him beyond belief as he saw tons of dirt and sweat drop from the pads overhead. The dark bulges were clearly tougher than anything he'd ever seen and would crush him or trap him without ever giving the boy any notice, like his own, they were hard from carrying such weight over time. The Lieutenant rubbed his feet on the rock and like Tom, didn't feel much.

Before he could react, the mountains ahead tipped forward and whipped towards Dan like a curtain of destruction. Getting bigger and bigger as soon the horizon was blocked out to be replaced by furry toes....
13112.title: Big boy's games

131121.content:
At the start, Dan was sent into the air by winds from the foots movement, then as he came down it felt like being in space and dodging asteroids. Normally microscopic particles of dirt dwarfed Dan and filled his vision as he made his descent towards the foot and as it moved up towards him. It seemed big enough to cover countries and maybe it could, so far, no clear measuring comparisons had been found.

In a flash, the Lieutenant was shooting through miles of fur and finally hit warm, but unyielding flesh. For a few seconds he was out cold, but came to as the titan continued to move, but at this size, Tom had his own gravity and it was defeating the planet's. Behind him, a forest of fur stretched into the sky, each strand larger around than a city. However, in front of him, there was a huge drop leading down to a valley-filled, black shiny surface. Things hit home, the black thing was a single toe-nail and it stretched beyond sight, seemed flat instead of round.

Everyone who'd been shrunken must still have been shrinking, and now they were microscopic. To either side, grass shot by unimaginably tall and trees couldn't be fathomed, heck these toes couldn't be imagined or quantified in any sane way. For now the little lupine would just have to survive on his little stretch of land, found on the toes of his possibly planet sized, 'little' brother. To entertain him while he formulated escape and getting normal again, he had the world's greatest display of power as dirt and rock shot by along with 'little' particles.

Tom meanwhile, was pursuing some friends going off to play soccer or maybe wrestle, he didn't care which. A few minutes ago, he could've sworn he saw his brother shrinking, but that was absurd. So, he instead covered the maybe 300 meters to the sports fields, intent on enjoying a good game with some friends, even a few cats.
131121.title: Small Survival

1311211.content:
Suddenly, laughter boomed through the area, but it wasn't as loud as the giant's, it just didn't have the boom on that scale, but it was near-by and still strong enough to rattle anyone down through their bones. What could do this? Fleas and bugs didn't talk, or at least had never been proven to, though they would be large enough to make just this level of noise. Not bugs, not giants, and there weren't any other people in sight, what was it?

Suddenly, an enormous object, just as big around as a city or in this case, a strand of fur. Whatever it was, it stretched into the sky beyond sight miles and miles away, too far for Dan to reach any time soon. It seemed though, he wouldn't have to, as more moved, one after the other as the laughing continued. They covered miles in every movement, whatever they were, they were huge and there were quite a few of them.

As the creatures closed, the Lieutenant took cover by a piece of fur, the imperfections in it formed caves and for a few seconds he considered taking cover in one. In the end that was a bad idea and it was not to be put into use at the moment, aside from getting lost there was the possiblitly of the fur being shedded, stranding Dan in a potentially worse situation. Of course, it was hard to come up with things worse than being on your little brother's foot, at a size so small his padded toes would level countries with ease, when he was so large that your tiny form stuck to him from a gravitational pull.

Suddenly, a shadow blocked out what light there was to be had, as a huge object with five black surfaces on a sea of orange passed over head, then one similar but in a sea of grey. It was soon clear that these were shrunken cats and wolves, but they dwarfed Daniel by miles, they were probably ten meters away on their scale when they first became visible and that wasn't anything above their toes. This meant Dan was a rare case, and he envied them their size, big enough that Tom's gravity didn't effect them, as they were each clinging on to the fur to avoid getting thrown off.
1311211.title: Rare Case

13112111.content:
Tom picked up the pace, and suddenly the world went upside down as a continent fell to the ground. Dan was stuck on the foot as a result of the gravity, so as the leg went up, he saw just how big his 'little' brother was, at least the rest of his body and it seemed more like machine of destruction than anything else. The force of course, sent the larger cats and dogs flying all over, and when they got up, one was right by Dan.

A toe taller than a skyscraper slammed down and moved out as weight came in. It nearly missed, but the force of impact was enough to make an Earth-quake, er, Tom-quake. The massive pad was visible only for seconds, 3000 ft' tall, and then it was gone as the little lupine was shot skyward, then came the forest of fur...
13112111.title: On a 'little' titan

1313.content:
Felines and Lupines raced out of the camp when they saw the light of the shrink ray, they wanted to see what was going on and maybe even be a part of it. For most of them, the light looked cool, pretty and had to be a part of some ultra-awesome-amazing game. It wasn't too far to the village either, a couple miles but even for kids, animals were pretty fast runners. Pretty quickly, footprints of barefoot kids filled the mud, four toes and one center pad holding all the weight and claws to dig in and make traction.

The spec ops team, charged with the defensive role, followed the kids from the shadows. Any threats would end up neutralized with deadly force and on top of that, they did need recon on that bright flash, whatever it was. Quiet as mice, but not their targets, the wolves moved on in the back of the pack and in places where no one would ever see them.

The kids had a blast, racing to where the village should have been, their short legs and little feet propelling them as absolutely fast as they could. It wasn't far now until they would reach the edge of the village to see what was up. They were already near-by and already a few felines were recieving shocks when they saw what looked like four mountains slam into the ground near-by and another five in the distance before taking off to hit again farther away.

In the village, the shrinking had taken the whole place and packed it into a spot that was barely a spec. When it receded, the grass and trees were sucked into the void left by the receding buildings. It made it seem that the village had never existed. In the village, four hundred thousand cats looked out of their city at stalks of grass that didn't reach their digitigrade ankles minutes ago now passed into the sky far over their home.
1313.title: Cub Control

13131.content:
The cats were barely specs in the world, the grass reached a few miles into the sky and bugs could walk over the city without even remotely risking a collisioin with even its tallest buildings. If a piece of grass fell, that would doom a huge chunk of the city, if not possibly all of it, in an instant. An object of a few ounces was more like a few hundred tons, and things had not yet reached the large objects barreling this way.

Khesk and S'tie lead the pack, charging through grass still wet with dew and through little stretches of mud without worry of the cleaning it'd take to get the mud off them later. At the back of the pack, the kids more worried for their looks or cleanliness were going around all these areas as widely as they could. A whole lot of girls were able to keep their claws painted nice and clean, while the male cats got to say their hind claws were sharper than needles and all the shinier for it. In between there were others who just simply were slower than the leaders, but of similar mind-set.

A few minutes later, the cats were looking up at the muddy feet of the two sole biggest things they had ever seen. Water and dirt dripped off their claws and fur, both now darkened back to the ankle and knees. The view was not liked and made the felines wish they'd had more grass around so the city wouldn't be surrounded by spotty areas of coverage. It was sure that the wolf would drive a single claw through the city and end it, or that if that failed, the cat would accidentally level it.

"I don't get it, this should be the city center" S'tie said, she just couldn't figure this one out. There wasn't a sign of home anywhere, and it should be right here where she was standing, skyscrapers, houses, the works of modern infrastructure.

"Look at the grass" Khesk said, "it never used to be here and look at the pattern, it gets thinner as it comes to this point." He made a mark in the ground with his foot, creating five new lakes for the cats, with a miles drop until there was any water, where they just barely missed the city. "Perhaps they were sucked underground, something had to pull this inward."

"Maybe" S'tie said as she and Khesk got low to the ground, on all fours to see if there was any sign of civilization. Particularly, they were looking for any signs of movement downward or a hole from the center spire of the city poking through.

Khesk's white hands, the match to his formerly white feet combed over the ground, many times nearly hitting the city. Down below, it was whiping the cats into a frozen frenzy, not daring to move even the slightest of inches. Two cubs blocked out the sun for thousands of miles in any direction just laying close to the ground, it would be a total black out if they would stand again.
13131.title: Mega-micro

131311.content:
"I don't see anything" Khesk said as he stood up, looking around at all the kids flooding into the area, there wasn't a sign of the city to be had.

"Me neither" S'tie said, following her companion's lead, something was way amiss here, but what could it possibly be? She'd find it eventually, the question was, when.

In the city, caked on mud dominated everyone's view along with the fresh stuff still dripping wet off the titan's toes. In the distance, more and more of the masses could be seen closing in, masses of power off the scale of any known measuring system. The fierce power held by the cubs was undoubted and unchallenged, though they all hoped to come out of this without the titans noticing.

Suddenly, all went black, as a mass of dark pads flew at the city....
131311.title: Underfoot

1313112.content:
S'tie's immense toes splayed around the city, the distance from toe to toe was hundreds of miles, the city was safe from that threat. However as soon as they hit the ground, the dirt and all sank miles with the immesuarable weight. It left the nano-city surrounded by a single little girl's toes, cut off from any light by something 2 inches tall. From below with the cats it now looked more like some unending canyon, they had only the slightest idea that their was grass in one direction.

The walls were covered in mud caked on and mostly dried so as to create caves, mountains, cliffs and more. It was wettest at the top and bottom, from the very top mud dripped down on the city like giant boulders raining from the sky. Then, a small pebble caught in some of this mud came down and nearly flattened the city, the feline never even would have noticed the quarter inch rock.

Things next got worse as the giantess lifted her foot. The toes closed in as the foot lifted away with less weight on it, but at the same time, the pads and toes themselves had been shoved far below the city. It resulted in the feline buildings being caught on a piece of mud and then caught half way up against the toes by a combination of toe-jam and mud. They were on a platform that easily supported the city and its inhabitants, even under the immense forces of the female's movements.

"So, what now?" Khesk's voice boomed, reaching even the microscopic feline ears in between the toes.
1313112.title: Felines on a feline

choices: Take them to the wolves, we'll decide what to do with them there.
Keep it a secret, enslaving the felines might prove worthwhile.
132.content:
A familiar scent fills the area, the leader of the felines, Leonus, staring upwards into the sky, shocked at what this flaw could mean for them. Turns out it may be even worst than the wolves, the scent flowing all over the area becoming obvious to the tiny citizens of the town. "MICE!" Someone shouts and as if on que a large voice booms over the area. "It seems you were trying to attack our allies. Did you forget that we were the ones that were forced to provide you with this technology? Did you really think we would not sabotage it?" Leonus looks at his head engineer with a snare, the panther backing away slowly unsure of whether he should fear the mice or his leader.

"You will now be directed towards your containment jars where you will await your fate. Anyone who argues or tries to escape will be terminated." The mice are serious and the populace knows it. Still, there are those who run and end up a little red stain on the ground, these littered throughout the city as the felines are grouped on in jars by the mice surrounding the now tiny village grins on their previously little rodent faces showing maliciousness and even perhaps thoughts of revenge.
132.title: Mice?

choices: The Mice Enslave the Feeble Cats
Other Enemies of the Felines' Want to See What Cat Tastes Like
1322.content:
Since any creature can remember, cats have been on top when it came to mice. The mice have become tired of this treatment, and rigged the shrink cannon, which the mice had exchanged for rights against being mistreated, to backfire on the cats, effectively bringing the cats to their knees before the mice.

The cats were about one foot high compared to the mice now, the perfect size to be dominated, humiliated, and enslaved at.

As the "massive" rodents enjoyed terrorizing the felines into submission, the feeble cats were forced into high-tech containment jars, which could be easily transported to the mouse HQ. With almost all of the felines into their containers, the few cats that were stupid enough to attempt to run away were hit with tranquilizers and dragged to the execution area, outside of the city. The executioner was a rat. Rats were usually in conflict with mice, but they both shared a common enemy: the now-pathetic cats.

Leonus, the leader of the felines, called his bodyguard force and tried to make it to a vehicle bay, where several evacuation vehicles were held. Alas, a mouse saw his escape attempt. This mouse, by the name of Lorus, smashed the bodyguard and dragged Leonus to the Execution area.

The execution, Drastar, smiled when he saw the cat approaching. Drastrar spat in the face of Leonus as Lorus left, leaving the cat at the mercy of a rat who has been waiting for the moment to have the oh-so-mighty Leonus under his foot. The cat spouted some nonsense about how he would be avenged and the such. Drastar was annoyed by this and wanted to shut him up. He hadn't been to the bathroom for a while, so he simply raised his tail above the tied-up Leonus' face, and squeezed a turd into his mouth. Drastar felt good, knowing that he had just declared the cats only worthy of his feces, but he would also probably get a promotion, as his job was more humiliation than execution. "taste good, you pathetic cat?" he mocked Leonus. Drastar then used his claw to slice through the rope that was bonding the cat, and flipped the cat over with his belly exposed. The rat then stomped his foot down on Leonus so hard, the piece of feces in his mouth went soaring out along with a screech from the cat. Leonus set his foot on
the weak Leonus. "Do you know what we do with the cats that wander in our territory?" Drastar said. Leonus weakly shook his head. "We eat 'em!" Drastar whispered to Leonus. Drastar then hoisted the cat in the air. He noticed Leonus' erection as he was lifted up, which Drastar chuckled at. The rat then shoved Leonus onto his tongue, face-first to humiliate him further. Leonus, being tossed around the rat's mouth, then realized that he wasn't going to have the luxury of being swalloed. He realized that was about to be chewed up. The cat was eventually raised on a tooth, and whimpered as he was brutally shoved deeper into the tooth. The next bite was from a sharper tooth, and Leonus had a large puncture in his abdomin, and each bite made more cuts and scars. Then, one bite made a massive gap in his abdomin, dwarfing the other deformities. Much to drastar's enjoyment, blood started oozing out the rat's mouth. After more bites, Leonus was in horrible pain as he was a bloody mess now. Drastar squished the remnant of Leonus between his mollars one more time before he swalloed the bloody mess, and licked the yummy cat blood and guts off his lips.

Severl hours later, after many entertaining beheadings of cats, Drastar felt the need to do his
business again. He slowly squeezed out a large turd, which he squished underfoot, declaring Leonus nothing but dirt that he trampled underfoot. With Leonus' humiliation and Delicious execution complete, he got onboard a transport, headed for the mouse HQ.

This was truly the day that marked the cats' fall underfoot of their enemies. With their main city dealt with by the mice, the rest of the cats' enemies would move in on their weak and humiliated enemy. The cats' arch enemy, the canine, rodent's of all kind, birds, and even zebras were now ready to bring their enemy to it's knees.

They all desired to spit in the face of the defeated felines, and that was know possible.
1322.title: The Mice Want Revenge

choices: Love at First Sight.  Romeo and Juliet.
"Daddy!  I want him as my slave!"
13221.content:
On board the mouse transport named "Cat Slayer", Drastar and a Mouse Transport captain, Torak, talk.
"Beheadings, really, Drastar?" Torak said.
"I'm just giving those sorry feline asses what they deserve,"

Several hours later...

Torak brought the hover transport through the HQ's inner networks to sublevel 13, a section that was designed specifically for the torture and storage of cats. As the vessel landed, Captain Torak called his daughter, Amaya, to check on the prisoners. The only slaves on board were the prince, princess, and queen of the felines, and the last of their royal family.

As Amaya checks on the Princess and Queen, she restores their normal size, and has a robotic arm move their cages onto a hover trolly.
Onwards, Amaya eyed the prince. There was something special about him.
13221.title: A Cargo of Slaves

choices: Execution of the Feline Royal Family
132212.content:
Amaya restores the prince's size, and marks him has her property on the datapad. The cat is sent away on another trolly.

Finally with the cats finally imprisoned, the mice are ready to begin business.
132212.title: The Enslavement of The Cats Begins

1322121.content:
The execution of the feline queen and princess was going to be televised on mouse TV, as they were fed to captive beasts.

First, the queen walked in. As the Mice were a subsidarie of the canine empire, the wolf emperor was seated their, initiating the execution.
Queen Sylora of the Felines was forced on her knees before the wolf emperor, who gave the order to shrink the queen down to half a centimeter. With the cat in the palm of Emperor Wolfus' hand, pleading and begging for mercy, he dropped Queen Sylora in the square foot sand pit in front of him.

This sand was home to a gargantuan Ant Lion.
The queen fell hard into the sand. After getting up, she looked around, completely oblivous of the monster that was hungry. After giving up her attempts to plead for mercy, she slowly walked, thinking about why she had to have this fate. While walking, she tripped at the edge of a large pit. The ignorant queen snooper around the edges of the pit when, suddenly, the whole ground began trembling. The cat was knocked over and began rolling downward. Unable to see the massive jaws at the bottom she didn't make much of an attempt to stop rolling. Within little time, the feline screamed as it was grabbed by the jaws and dropped into a mouth. She was slowly pulled into the creature's stomach. By the time her massive breast were just above the mouth, her whole body was quickly sucked into the stomach, where this bitch-of-a-cat was slowly and painfully turned into a soft mush.
1322121.title: Bye-Bye Cat-Girls

13223.content:
Though few made it, some cats escaped the city with their lives. Now, cats aren't generally ones to wander the forest, as the whole world hated them. You would never know when dogs would cook you up and eat you, birds would swallow you, and the worst of all were the wolves. The wolves were the specific canines chose to deal with the cats, and they would love to torture, eat, kill, and humiliate cats.

Most of the survivors were alone, as they were never able to group together. This is the reason that every creature in the forest saw a cat as an easy and delicious meal.

Can you survive the forest?
13223.title: Survival

choices: Take the role of a feline
133.content: A wolf of about 6' in height with gray fur, brown tips (to the ears, fingers, and toes) arrives first, surveying the damage to make sure the felines are in fact shrunken. Khesk, the wolf's name, makes his way into the seemingly empty area, the only thing tipping him off to th survivors being the squeaking and shrieks going on everywhere. A quick step, a pop, and then a crunch emits from beneath his foot and upon lifting it he finds the crushed remains of a little tiger. He cringes slightly, but cheers are heard behind him as his pack mates now enter to claim their prize.
133.title: The wolves know exactly what happened and are i...

choices: What will happen to the cougar?
What will happen to the house cat?
What will happen to the (Your choice)
1331.content: Slam, boom, pop, noises are all around and the wolves are more than obviously here to take your people hostage. All around you hear commands being issued, yowls and growls evidence of the captures made throughout your home. You're hidden for now, taking cover inside of your home though it isn't long before one of the gigantic lupines slam your door down and enter. Unfortunately wolves can smell very well and it's not long before they're on you a few massive toes slamming down before your position beneath a bed- the only place you could reach at 3 inches in height. The toes splay and the wolves talk for a moment, sniffing around before you feel the ground rumble, the weight of the wolf being shifted onto that massive paw before your face. You see a pair of large hands grasp your bed and lift it... 4 yellow eyes stare down a you and before you can react a massive paw lifts and knocks you several feet out from under your bed and onto the floor. While your recovering the huge weight of a single toe settles onto your body and you're pinned.... Captured.
1331.title: Take the role of  a feline

choices: What will happen to the tiger?
13313.title: Tigers?

133131.content:
The little tiger mews in fear as the toe is on its body; the toenail cutting into the body.

The wolf captor laughs at the tiger's pathetic attempts to hide. It shouldn't even have tried, because the punishment will now be more severe. Wolves can smell prey from a mile away. "You shouldn't have run, tiggy! Now, your punishment will be decided by a council of wolves, exactly like me! Your chances of survival are next to nothing! I would pop you right now, but I'm under orders! Now come." The wolf picks up the small tiger and walks out.
133131.title: What will happen to the tiger?

1332.content:
Khesks walked as a giant among the tiny felines. A few times he wondered what one might taste like, but decided he would have a true enemy for a snack rather than the many civilians. After a while, he found one standing still in shock and at last had something to measure against besides the stains on his pads. The tiny creature was just barely tall enough to touch the top of his toes, that is if the cat were to jump and reach out, with a boost from a fair-sized pebble.

The lupine went to crush the creature when he noticed something extremely odd going on all around him, that made him forget the tinier-than-toes creature and think of the bigger picture....
1332.title: Follow Khesk

13321.content:
The radiation of the shrink ray was still drifting through the area and this dilute, it would effect anything around its impact radius, cats, dogs and any complex organism. For Khesk, the distances around him seemed to swell and grow at an exponentially changing rate. For a wolf, he was between tall and average but was now starting to hit the average and short range, moving through it at a remarkable pace.

Within seconds, the more than an inch deep pit made by his feet and pads, surrounded by more three or four deep made by his claws was a substantial part of his vision. First he found himself standing in one footprint with room for barely both his feet, the pooled sweat from his formerly massive pads just coming up to the bottom of his foot. Soon he was in a pit deep enough to be some kid's splashing pool and later, deep enough to be turned into a fair-sized fox-hole. Through the whole process he was staring around in shock as pounds multiplied into hundred and then thousands of pounds, followed by the ounces, keeping in time with the distances. A single pace soon came to take up a few hundred as his feet got smaller and his legs shorter.

Suddenly, his thoughts were whiped over to the cat from earlier, standing almost as tall as he was now...
13321.title: Continuity Wide

133211.content:
The feline was bigger than the lupine, much, much bigger. Khesk was climbing up the wall of the crater made by one of his pads and overhead a cat was clearly towering above him capable of getting down there in a single jump and out in a step or two while the wolf was having to struggle and climb to get out. A single hole from one of his pads was now deep enough to hold a whole lake when an instant ago his sweaty foot was capable of leveling that same lake without moving a full inch.

When at last he had reached the top, he found the cat was as much larger to him, as he had been to the cat minutes ago. The titan's toes stood tall in front of him, splayed wide with the massive weight of the creature. Like that, the wolf could walk between them like some massive hall and not fear getting caught, that's how much room there was, and a normal wolf or cat would be too large to comprehend.

All the while though, Khesk continued to shrink. The radiation of the shrink ray was built with a back-blast sort off effect in it, the first shot would shrink people a bit and then leave them be, but the radiation that lingered was far more potent and would effect whatever else came to the rescue of the shrunken ones with an even stronger force. It would have double, maybe triple the effect of the initial blast, making the scale for the smallest life form looking up sit like 'tiny', 'giant', 'continent'.
133211.title: First Effect

1332111.content:
As Khesk continued to shrink, he looked up at the titan before him, figuring it may pay to have some idea of the layout for the soon to be landscaped size enemy. He saw something shocking, the titan was just a ten year old kid, which explained his inaction and why he'd yet to make the wolf into a stain on his paws. That put the kid, on his own scale at four feet tall or so, which meant the wolf was smaller than he thought.

Overhead, the enormous form of the cat started to move, whatever fear had held him there was now wearing off. He lifted a foot a few inches on his scale and brought it down, just shifting his weight as the trance wore off. The Earthquake that followed shook Khesk to the bone and launched him into the air. He wound up directly in front of the cat's toes, and was now so short he could've walked under them. There was a short distance out here where the pad's kept a fair amount of each toe off the ground, and to Kehsk that space was like a cavern with no end. Each pad towered overhead to a sky-scrape tall ceiling of fur.

One of the titanic toes suddenly shot toward Khesk, it was a small movement normally but seemed hyper-sonic. He ran and just barely avoided it as it moved and then shot into the air, wiggling in a way, the kid testing his limbs that they worked. After that, sweat bombed off the pad overhead, a single drop could fill a lake. As the little lupine ran ever farther, the bombardment only increased, the kid was in a major cold sweat and a major terror to the troop. He'd kill the little lupine with ease and never know it was his toe that did it from a few milimeters off the ground.

A second later, the rain ceased as it was replaced by the enormous space of a toe coming down instead. It pressed down into the dirt rather than sit over it as earlier and almost did end Khesk. The wolf survived, caught in a tiny space left open by the fur. When the weight lifted from him though, it was in the wrong place. A sea of sweat had turned mud clung to the toe into goop and clung to the wolf, or more accurately barely held to the cat and held a nanoparticle to it.

Far above, the pre-teen titan Horack was shaking off the sudden fear of death he'd had and his memories of shrinking. One minute he was chasing a soccerball through the grass, the next he was walking through the grass like a field. Normally small bugs were like moderate sized animals. He at first had just stomped on them like a larger than normal bug, their slime had coated his feet up toward the ankle but that was just that. Gradually, the bugs got bigger. He had to start kicking them, and then it was a fist-fight with a club, then he was looking up at the bugs, now small enough for them to kick or crush underfoot. Not much later, he'd found a huge drop, he stretched forever and was soon discovered to be a rut left from him kicking that soccerball earlier. He perhaps stood a chance against only a flea now. Everything had shattered when he looked up at a creature which would kill him for sure, a Wolf, and was so many times lower than the claws came down.

As the shock wore off, he put one microscopic foot in front of the other and walked on through the forest of grass. He remembered very vaguely the wolf shrinking and then a bug to him showing up, but that was all. The only solution was to walk this off.
1332111.title: Along for the ride

133212.content:
Though the cat had been about this height earlier, he was still just as small to Khesk as he had been earlier, at least from his current view, it was hard to tell how small something was when it was standing on a ledge twice your height above you and getting farther away by the instant.

Khesk jumped up on the curved walls of his footprint and started clmibing, making little impressions in it as he went, covering less and less distance all the time. When he was at last on top, the hole made by the pads under one of his toes was eight times his height, 50 ft. deep. His form at the start of the climb was now a giant in its own right.

The cat was standing in the same place as before, small enough now that a normal sized anything would never have seen it. He still fit under the lupine's claws, so at the least the creature was not a threat, though he could potentially be of assistance. Khesk bent down and carefully got the little feline on one of the pads of his hand and held him there while he fished for anything to put him in, eventually coming up with a plaster container full of cotton for treating wounds. It had no holes, but for a creature the size of the cat, it had enough air for days.

Inside, T'ornai, the feline, found himself in a sea of white. Beams of it criscrossed through the whole skyscraper of a container and seemed to defy gravity as it held upright with ease despite its softness in places. He was still in shock about his size, but isolation from the world and just how huge things were had started to weaken its grip on him. At least it would until he realized what he was in and standing on. For now though, he found himself in a glass building with weird white guts that were comfortable and soft under his pads.

Meanwhile, Khesk walked through a macroforest of grass, watching it grow every minute, but at the same time, more gradually as his reduction in size came to a steady halt.
133212.title: Equality Effect

1332121.content:
A sudden boom filled the aair with a force to dwarf any explosions and then an earthquake rocked the world all around as someone new entered the scene after the radiation had passed. After a few minutes, it was a constant thing, but luckily at this distance the shaking was not enough to knock over anything major or bring harm to Khesk.

Gradually, though, it got worse until at last a huge wall stretching into infinity slammed down a kilometer ahead of him....
1332121.title: Expected Force

1332122.content:
The ground heaved and rocked with the force of a million earthquakes amplified a thousand times. As soon as one of the quakes was gone, the others filled in for its disappated force. Khesk couldn't keep his footing and fell. On the ground, he held still and just tried to keep from getting thrown around, but that was nearly impossible. It was as if the ground were a storm on the seas.

Suddenly, a massive wall of green struck the ground, dug under, moved forward and then kicked up with a million billion tons of force. It hit dead-in where Khesk was and when it moved up sent him into the sky like some particle of dust or maybe even something smaller than that. Either way, the Lupine's three hundred pounds of weight, at least to him, didn't have much effect on how things went.

As he soared skyward, Khesk found himself passing the grass and was to him, incomprehensibly high up. From there, he peered around and saw the lat thing he had expected; kids! The entire area was filled with the titanous cubs of the major species: human, lupine, feline and there may even have been a mouse or two. There was just one question though, where had they come from?

A few seconds later, there came an answer as the little lupine saw a very clear symbol where he'd just come from. The huge green wall was some 'little' girl's enormous flip-flop. On the white canvas of her skin, there was a continetal image painted on with text reading "Camp Halliday-Play." The naming and odd spelling of course attracted kids, apparently just as much as the bright light from the shrink-ray. Today was Saturday, the camp counselor's day off, so the minimal staff couldn't hold the kids in.

By this point, Khesk was seven inches up by normal standards, but had moved forward three and was still going strong. As he looked around, he saw kids unleashing power he had only dreamed of and it was horrifying him to think he could end up in their targeting sights. Their toes spanned miles, even for the lupines known for having the tiniest toes of everyone except for the mice, had the trooper been that size, he'd have been unbeatable.
1332122.title: Unexpected force

13321221.content:
Khesk was getting lower and lower by the second, he'd land any minute now. He looked ahead and down to see an enormous lupine pad as his LZ. It would be hard as rock to him at this size, at least that's how it seemed, he'd never been around a pad of any sort over five miles thick.

Even if he made the landing, it'd be hard getting down. The kid was laing on his stomach with his feet just sitting there, or was he?
13321221.title: With kids

133212211.content:
The enormous black pads got closer every second, the grooves that made up all the gripping of the monolithic shape seemed like valleys flooded by some river or ocean. That of course was false, it was a mass of sweat that was flooding around and keeping the feet cool. The only question though, was Khesk that small?

There was no right way to take this landing, so as he closed in on the miles of pad that had only been two inches, if that earlier, he closed his eyes and waited to see what would happen. Globs of sweat that made him look like a cell by comparison weren't the sorts of things he wanted to see before stuff went south; neither did he want to see a formerly two foot long tail that seemed large enough to bridge oceans or reach up to the stars.

He was next aware of...
133212211.title: Approach

133212212.content:
Gredan was laying down to start a game of soccer. The lupines had altered it a bit from the human's version though. For one thing, at the start you had to start with someone holding the ball up and then it would get kicked far into the sky towards the other goal. This wolf did things differently, usually you laid down and held it with your hands, well he'd been kicked a few too many times in the head that way so he'd hold it with his feet.

Khesk saw a huge white and black sphere suddenly fill his vision, it was like a planet. Before he got a chance to reach it though, he saw it suddenly disappear and then he found an enormous surface coming up under him, so fast he barely even noticed it. All around him was an enormous forest, he could barely see outside its canopy, it was just that thick.

Suddenly, mud, dirt and water rained down from the sky, the huge branchless trees were the only shelter. At times though, even they seemed to fail. Khesk held on though, he needed to find out where he was and somehow get home, he'd promised his brother Vad'rie he would when last he left home. Too many promises had been broken before and he wouldn't be breaking this one.

Vad'rie had followed his friends here, some said they found tiny wolves and cats, but he didn't believe them. If there were, they were no threat to him and he'd just crush the felines; as for lupines, he doubted a wolf would ever stand it. So, here he was, playing soccer. He'd kicked the ball off and was now running after it, his feet dipped into mud and then came right back out again or in some cases just tore it up. The most annoying thing though was getting them wet with the dew on the grass, he hated wet fur.
133212212.title: Soccer

13322.content:
The little creature at the wolf's toes was continuing to dwindle in size even as he looked down at it. This made the big picture much easier, one shot of the shrink ray and the enemy would dwindle in stature and keep doing so until who knew when. This thing had long-lasting effects, if the same thing carried to the wolve's shrink ray, then they could end any enemy with a single shot.

Khesk looked down at the ever dwindling cat, now small enough that he had to his neck up to see where the toe-nails emerged from the foot. It all added to the creature's shock down below and cold though the wolf was, he began to consider helping this one cat and maybe another. Then came the last straw when the titanic lupine noticed that the thing in front of him was a young cub.

All the enemies were supposed to be accounted for, but there were going to be felines getting eaten and meddled with, why couldn't one still innocent be saved? Slowly, the foot that had held firm in front of the cat drew back and the enormous creature came to a crouch, holding out a single claw on his fingers to scoop up the tiny thing. Seconds later, it was riding in a tin stuffed with cotton, inside the breast pocket over the dog's heart.

T'ornai had his world turned upside down today. Everything had suddenly gotten bigger except his house and friends, then the giants came and it all turned upside down. He had been as tall as the grass, but as he ran he found himself getting smaller and smaller. Finally, tiny T'ornai came undone when when a bug had nearly squashed him. Cat's ate and trampled bugs. He still had bug-cuts on his pads and between his toes from stomping on a few this morning.

Next thing he knew, there was this huge wolf's foot in front of him, if he jumped he might be able to get on top and climb to the top. The shrinking thouch continued, the wolf's toes were titans in their own right and then, for some reason T'ornai was moving off the ground and into some weird soft container that seemed to hold a bulding made of soft stuff. It closed and then wound up in some other container, the temperature was comfortable and light was non-existent, but it was comfortable and an odd rythmic boom in the background made a sense of calm.

In the land of giants, Khesk kept moving on, eventually he found another cat, it was bigger than the last, but then the last was a very young cub. It was also quite daring, the creature charged at the wolf's foot, but did no harm, the titan didn't notice the slightest sensation. All the while though, he had wondered what a cat tasted like, despite the little one he had just adopted.

While the creature was attacking, the wolf bent down, grabbed him and through him in his mouth. The feline was smaller than any of the lupine's teeth, but there was still enough of him there for there to be a taste of chicken. On his tongue, the creater barely registered to be there and then went down the back, falling down a hole thousands of feet wide.
13322.title: Continuity Limited

133221.content:
After a bit of walking and searching, the wolf sat down with his back against a rock and his legs out in front of him. As he sat there, he closed his eyes and let his head lay back as he soaked up the afternoon sun in the shadless, treeless clearing that had once held a city. Here, he had no boss to worry about as spec ops ran their own chain of command and he was the only spec ops troop here.

Far below, a creature just about microscopic from his size was charging the wolf. He had seen his little brother get picked up by the giant and had been following him ever since. He left little footprints leading to and around those of the larger lupine, which to D'rie were bottomless pits.

At last, the titan sat down and D'rie leapt up his sides as he climbed, and climbed and climbed to the pocket he'd seen his brother in. Tiny paw prints of dirt were left on each thread as he went and after about two hours, he reached his goal, but then there was something special about him that so far, no one knew and would not know for a long time.

The side of the pocket was a cathederal, the flap that closed it left a normally small gap but currently huge for the cub to slip through. He got in just as Khesk got up, which made it a challenge to reach his brother's prison, but in the end, he did.
133221.title: Another Adoption

1332212.content:
