D'rie woke up in his usual place for the seven hundredth time since the disaster had happened, now just over two years ago. His bed was a very carefully constructed object of cotton and wood fragments with blankets made of materials retrieved from the shrunken city on return trips. He oddly never found a bed, so he had his current one, when it was built it was too small for him but a month later he'd shrunken to the point that it was ten times the size needed. Nowadays, his shrinking had pretty much stopped, with an occurance every now and then, but they were pretty minor.

The little feline's 'room' consisted of a four inch area marked off by tape on his 'big', but younger adopted brother's night-stand. As a result, there was an enormous wall in the distance, but his little feet had scaled it many times, as size was not enough to stop him from living life. This cat was just as mobile as one of the giants, though his little and only true person smaller than him was not.

"Time to wake-up little bro" Jack boomed from above, you looked up to see his enormous head looking around the night-stand. He put a hand down on the tape and like that, D'rie was off and running for it, a minute later, he was surrounded by towers of fur miles tall and miles around sitting on muscles the size of techtonic plates. Everything zoomed around as the arm was lifted and twisted, but it had no effect on the feline, he was so small now that the warm surface under his pads had a gravitational force more than adequeate to hold him.

So, he walked on to his usual perch, he'd get there and spend the whole day sitting or goofing off. He'd pulled some odd pranks but at his size, no one had ever seen or known of them. Of course, only the family knew he existed in the first place.
1332212.title: Home - 2 years later

13322121.content:
Jack headed out of the room and as he entered the family room, he tripped, going down with a force greater than gravity, at least the gravity holding D'rie. When the continent caught itself on the way down to sort of stop in a push-up, the force hurtled the feline loose of gravity and towards the ground.

The fur was gone in an instant and then off in the distance, the giant's muzzle passed by slowly like a planet going by out in space. Hundreds of miles off to the sides, huge mountains stretched to the ground and out into a mountain range covered in forest. It was a bit scary how big things truly were now, though if things were swapped, the cat would be even bigger than the canine.

D'rie looked down at the solid wooden floor below approached. At this point he was just passing his brother's toes as the giant got up and moved on, without even noticing his missing passenger. Finally, it was time to land, whatever had shrunken the cats had done it with a few advantages; their molecular structure was a very good shock absorber, if you land right, you can survive scratch-free. Limbs downward and spread wide, the cat hit like an artillery shell and rolled with the force until he was at a dead stop.

He stood, looking around, but could see no sign of Jack, who no doubt was thousands of miles away by now. Then, the floor rocked with another booming, and this was a bad boom, this was trouble, it was always trouble. At this size, the acoustic difference in the sound made by each persons pads was very clear, and this sound was among the worst.
13322121.title: Bad to be tiny

133221211.content:
The sound was Ralie, the younger of the wolves coming. At five years old he barely made the four foot mark but he was always wanting to go around with his brothers or at least play with them, including the smallest intelligent thing in the house. D'rie was of course dwarfed by the 'little' wolf, though had the shrinking never happened the kid wouldn't have even been chest high. The shrinking had happened though and right now, that giant was coming this way as a mechination of destruction.

"Hey, Ranie, big buddy, could you back up!" D'rie yelled, the splayed toes of the titan covered miles and miles of ground each, not to mention the large amounts of mud, water and filth dripping off, which was only a crush-risk. Of course, sometimes being heard was a bigger risk.

The wolf's enormous ears swiveled around for a second or two, the sound waves coming at him were smaller than even the tinniest insect's buzzing but all canids had remarkable hearing. He didn't understand it though, his head was too far off the ground to hear something that little, that low. So, he went about his business, continuing towards his little brother, leaving oceans of water and mud with each step.

If D'rie was scared before, he was going through horror right now. Somehow, he could cover immense distances despite micorscopic feet and legs, but even the walk of a 5 year old was faster than him. His smallest pad alone stretched 18 miles, and that wasn't even the whole toe. Figure then, the kid's stride at being 300 miles or more given the miles and miles of legs compared against the two microns covered by the cat.

For the feline, there was nothing to do, the kid couldn't be outrun and the toes were too wide to get out of their path if he knew where that was. Not to mention if not for the gravity of the wood, the cat would've been launched into the air. Then, in an instant, the sky was dark as five mountains coming off of a country slammed into the ground all around D'rie. He opened his eyes to...
133221211.title: Young

1332212111.content:
At the point when the cat was about to become crushed-cat, he had been thinking about something shrinking his enormous brother. He had no girlfriend to think of, so all that was left was some way to live. For him, little lupine meant longer life-time. Somehow, that thought had become reality, the dog was gone. The mud though was all over, it must not have shrunken despite the canid's feet closing in around it.

In fact, if anything, the mud had grown. D'rie's footprints were on a bed of darkness three feet off the ground and continuing out a door that had been pushed open. As energy, nor mass can be destroyed, it was simply moved. The stuff that made up the canid had gone into the mud he was dragging around. With less density in the dirt than dog, that meant more dirt than would have happened if the dog had grown.
1332212111.title: Super-size?

13322121111.content:
D'rie shook the mud off himself and ran over to his brother, despite the miles of distance, it took only a few minutes to reach him. The dog was standing there in shock as things that were once dwarfs to him were now taller than any mountain. Near-by, a bouncy ball sat in the mud, filling a large part of the horizon even from here. It was small on a normal scale of course, not even close to reaching the young lupine's toes minutes ago. He knew, as he'd picked it up with his feet and thrown it while laying down, just to pass the time.

"Hey bro, welcome to the world of the microscopic" D'rie said as he stopped in front of the canid, towering over him. "I guess little bro now."

"H-h-hh-h-how small am I?" Ralie asked, though he was sure he didn't want to know the answer, it'd only do more to scare him. "And how did I get this small?"

Before an answer could be given, the ground shook with an earthquake's force and more as what had been the smallest wolf walked out towards the couch behind which the tiny siblings were standing. The approaching creature towered into the sky and walked with a slight waddle going from foot to foot. In minutes, he was even messier than his mud-loving brother had been

"Run!" D'rie yelled, grabbing Ralie and shoving him along, but he just wasn't fast enough, the three year old's stride was a few hundred miles, the lupine's was a few nanometers or less and he wasn't moving fast enough to make up for that. "I did this, maybe I can undo it."

The yelling, while near non-existent to the titan was still there and it got his attention. It seemed to be just a few steps ahead of him, whatever it was. Eventually, he stopped when his wet and muddy toes were about to crush it, at least by his best guess. For a second or two, he considered getting on his belly, but that would mean another bath, which he didn't want. It'd be easier to just crush these things, they were probably bugs or fleas anyway.
13322121111.title: Two tiny's and a titan

133221211111.content:
Five toes with matching black pads and spire-scaled claws loomed overhead on a sure-hit to destroying the feline and the formerly big-brother. Mud and water rained down in clumps the size of cities at the smallest, just barely missing the two tiny creatures, but not by much. In another fraction of a second, the little brother would prove he was the biggest even at his smallest part and in doing so, leave his siblings in a crater to them, miles deep.

D'rie focused on stealing mass from the dirt beneath his feet and putting it in himself, growing himself. In seconds, the dirt was sinking into non-existence or at the least smaller existence and at the same time, the feline was rapidly expanding, to him the world was shrinking. He was an amazon against the dog next to him, soon that little lupine was at his waist, his knees, his ankles and only kept getting smaller. This was no major height, but he felt like a giant.

Ralie saw his brother growing and growing in size as the dirt disappeared. At the same time, it was all enough to make his 'little' brother over-head back up a step or two. As the formerly tiny creature grew to a titan, the lupine noticed something was wrong though; even as he stood there, the world was growing, not just the cat. More than dirt was losing its mass, it seemed anything tiny enough to blend in with it was going to go too.

By this point, the wolf was looking up at the splayed toes of the cat, already four times his height. The mud and water at the sides made climbing there impossible, but there was another possibility. Somewhere, the mountainous digits had to connect and there it would be easiest to climb up and get away from the shrinking, maybe even grow. Ralie then ran forward, making some head-way even as the distances grew, soon the fur and flesh to either side surrounded him and left him in darkness.

This route though, was not as easy as it had seemed. Pebbles turned boulders were everywhere, pinned between the toes, caught in the fur and so on. Making matters worse, there was mud everywhere which lead only to slipping, sliding and general mess with loss of grip. Eventually, the little lupine, a ball of mud and toe-jam started to climb the rocks on the walls to either side of him, he was so small now or perhaps D'rie so large, that he was in something more like a valley or ravine than the space between someone's toes.

D'rie himself was just now coming on-level with the 3 year old wolf's toes, but was growing faster and faster.
133221211111.title: Tiny to titan

1332212111112.content:
D'rie stood full-sized next to his now, most definitely little brother. The kid was knee-high if that and energetic as ever to see someone new to play with. It wasn't quite connecting that his 'little' adopted brother had now grown and was bigger in size and still in years as before hand. The young lupine had several older brothers now to play with, at least he thought.

"Hey little buddy!" the cat said, picking up the wolf, now incredibly light and spinning him about, "nice to finally see you from here rather than down there!"

"Wee he hee he hee!" loughed the lupine as he was spun around in circles, being tickled by the centrifigal forces involved. He was having an absolute blast.

Rallie on the other hand, the now little lupine brother, was caught by the gravity made just by the toes of the feline. He could see quite far, but the distances were just huge, beyond imagining. He'd made it close to the top while he was larger, but the distance now would take days to cover, and this was just a short section of the toes, let alone the entire body. Far overhead, he saw the pads and toes of his 'little' brother as the titan feline hauled a billion, billion tons skyward with absolute ease. The young wolf was bigger than most countries, if the shrunken wolf made it across a pad that'd be like crossing Florida, if the chest, it'd be like crossing the whole of Europe. Through it all, this was just a three year old.
1332212111112.title: Being small

13322121111122.content:
Being big again made D'rie forget about the tiny thing trapped between his toes, he wanted to have fun with the things he'd had to avoid for his health's sake. A bike was pretty much a continental steam-roller that broke the sound barrier and challenged the speed of light, a ball was a model planet or asteroid projectile, a skate board was a forest of black spikes and an easy way to drown, a locker room was just an easy place to get killed by one of many species, a book was a country scaled building, and so on.

"So, where to start" the feline asked himself as he put the young wolf down, he had a lot on his list of things to do. At last it came to him: he'd never stopped running, but he had lost the scenery and parts to enjoy, but not now. "Hey little buddy, lets head out for a run."

The kid couldn't help but bounce around, he loved to play and now he could chase someone. For him it was almost as good as chasing that thing he'd heard on the floor earlier. Though that mystery was nagging him in the back of his mind, there was fun to be had!

Within seconds, they were out and running. Meanwhile, Rallie, was climbing, running and jumping to avoid an onslaught of dirt, grass and more getting flung at him. It was like climbing through moving mountains of spires stretching skyward and through it all having to dodge immense cities falling from the sky. The only advantage to being so small right now as the cat's toes were so massive, their gravity easily held the wolf down through the millions of G's of the running.

Eventually, D'rie came up on an old friend, but fear for years; mud. The stuff was hard to find in a way safe for him on his old scale of size. A puddle was an ocean covered planet, the pressure on one's foot at the bottom was enough to crush a creature that size like a tin-can, making it off-limits to him. Now though, he could jump and splash around in it like he used to as a cub.

It was dead ahead, up, splash and in the feline went. He loved the cooling water over his hot pads and the squishy mud between his pads and toes. His feet were only at the deep end for a few seconds, then it was all only about as tall as the toes, he kept going through that and then stopped at the end to wait on his little lupine friend following behind.

D'rie was soaked, he was coated in caked on dry grime one minute and the next it was soaking wet muck. He grabbed on tight to a piece of rock that was thoroughly caught on the toe as the water negated gravity and ripped at him to suck him off. For a second all he tasted was mud and sweat in his mouth, then air and then it repeated several times before at last he was in the air. All around, the spires were soaked and starting to sag downward with their weight and the effect of the water.

The lupine cub caught up a few seconds later, sloshing through the water and stopping right in front of the cat. He bounced time after time after time yelling, "more, more!" Then he changed the plan and bouncing up and down on the feline's feet yelled "uppy! uppy!"

Both sets of pads splayed wide and for a second the lupines slipped through the cats, his claws were doing a good job of scratching as they went up and down at the back of each toe. For Rallie though, it was like trying to dodge a hammer the size of Texas coming in and wreaking destruction every second. Boulders fell from the sky, spires, mud and more, not to mention the claws which were barely missing him. Eventually one enormous toe got him on the way back up.

D'rie calmed the kid down and got him to stop jumping while he thought about what to do next. For the little lupine, this was a relief as he got himself on a stable cliff between the titan's toes. He was now between the toes of his 'little' brother, they had been at the most, three inches long if you counted the whole bottom part of the foot. Rallie had once broken two of these mountains with his formerly five inch long foot, right now though, he wasn't able to even move anything, let alone break a couple hundred miles thick bone with his foot. Of course, the older brother had once had to look down to see his brother's ears, now he could look anywhere to see giant and his brother would have to get out a microscope to find him.
13322121111122.title: Ignored

133221211111222.content:
A realization struck D'rie, Rallie was no where in sight, and that lupine loved to run. Then he remembered that the wolf hadn't been grown and was still microscopic or smaller. A rescue was needed, and it was quite likely the tiny creature was still among them, Tarsi, the three year old wolf was right by his now little brother. He was likely somewhere on him.

"I got a new game buddy" D'rie said, he needed the soon to be large lupine to stay still so he could do this and not die. Running around, jumping and playing would just make it harder and more dangerous. Of course, the idea of getting small again wasn't too appealing either. "There's something hiding on you and we're gonna find it. I need you to hold still and I'll look."

"How? I can see more of me than you can" Tarsi asked, how was someone bigger than him, a relative amazon gonna find something small on his own body. It seemed the odds were in his favor more than the cat's.

"Guess I'll have to get smaller" D'rie said, leading the little lupine to a tree and forcing him to sit down in the brown/red dirt that surrounded it. "If you don't move, I might take you with me next time. There's all sorts of cool places we could go."

Tarsi believed it all, he hadn't yet learned some things were normally impossible. So, there he sat with his legs stretched in front of him, heels on the ground and toes way up in the air. He was resolved that he wouldn't move a single inch, not the slightest bit in any direction. It'd be cool to be small.

D'rie stood there thinking of what to put his mass in, it had to be something small so it wouldnt' get too big. To prove his abilites, the feline bent over and pulled a tiny piece of solidified mud off the fur of the lupine. He concentrated and thought of the pebble, himself and shrinking. Instantly the world began to expand all around, the pebble moved grew even faster, soon it was too heavy to hold and thudded to the ground with a bang. Soon, the wolf's feet were overhead as they reached into the air.

The wolf couldn't believe what he was seeing, something so big getting so small and vice versa for the pebble. When it disappeared behind his feet, he parted them just enough to see the formerly bigger brother stand shorter than his toes, but big enough to see. It appeared the cat was barely as big as a bug, and maybe he really wasn't.

To start at the ground up was D'rie's method. To pull it off he had to get on the lupine's toes which wouldn't be doable as far as he understood his powers. So, he'd shrink in bits as he moved and explored. Now a quarter inch tall, he walk to the enormous ankles and climbed up,grabbing the rung like furs as a ladder. At the top, he climbed along the foot to the toes and noticed how now his weight was just enough to make them dip. He pushed a toe down with his foot, all his weight just to experiment. Then standing on the middle digit, he repeated the shrinking process, the fur laying flat soon towered overhead, the enormous lupine eyes stared down at the toes as the cat disappeared amidst them, getting so small the toes were like states.
133221211111222.title: Rescue

choices: Just jump on to finding the guy
1332212111112222.content:
D'rie was surrounded by young wolf, fur and dirty toes so big, Mount Everest wouldn't be a snow flake on even one of them. The mud was all over, but drying more and more into huge mountains, making enormous obstacles in the land-scape, if everyone were this size, the dirt from the toes back to the ankle on this foot alone would make enough houses to hold a good many billion people. This was all just the mess on a little kid's little foot.

There was no where to go now but forward to find the shrunken wolf. Not long after getting started, though it was a good three hundred miles later, a huge canyon cut off the feline from his path. Truthfully, he'd yet to reach actual skin, besides fur, everything was dried or drying mud. At this scale, a layer of mud was extremely thick, earlier at a quarter inch tall this stuff was just thicker than the cat's foot was tall but now that even ammounted to many miles.

The solid, rock-hard dirt caught on the fur though provided an excellent means of climbing and D'rie used that to get a view of the area. Upward he shot and when he looked down there were five distinct holes, one for a center pad and four for the toes, this was where he'd pushed down to see if the giant limit could be moved. On the 'ground' the large hole seemed to go beyond the horizon, from up here, the four smaller holes went there and there was no sign of marks from the claws.
1332212111112222.title: It begins

13322121111122221.content:
Several hours later and countless hundred miles, the mission was at last over. Rallie was right in front of the cat, taking cover in a cave made of mud, it was for him the safest spot. The roof stretched into the sky and the immense tunnel stretched back towards the piece of fur it was formed around, who knew where it went? The mud was miles deep and covered a country, one may end up at the pads, between the toes or all the way back at the ankle. Soon though, this would just be another little kid again, his foot something measured in inches again rather than miles, only a threat to bugs.

"There you are" D'rie said, "come on lets go."

Scared stiff, Rallie didn't waste time in rushing out to the cat and hanging on while they would hopefully grow, but then things went bad. The middle wolf was one of two, he had a twin, Nardar, and he was coming down the path."Tarsi, what're you doing?" he asked, but didn't wait for a response, "come on, we got better things to do."
13322121111122221.title: Just jump on to finding the guy

133221211111222212.content:
Tarsi eagerly leapt up, easily thousands of miles into the sky before coming down with a shaking that would shatter the richter scale. The big brother was offering fun now, the other two were now little brothers, so as the bigger one, he'd show them fun with the 'biggest' of them all. Three year old logic seemed to put size directly with age.

"Come on, there's a fair in town" Nardar said, walking to the little one and pulling him along, "and I got wrist-bands, all the rides we want."

Far below, the world rocked for D'rie and Rallie, every footstep broke the sound barrier as the 'little' three year old hurried along. A glance up through the canopy of fur revealed the enormous form of Nardar, at least twice the size of their current trap. The two tiny's held on to each other and the environment, but were eventually blown through the landscape to become trapped in a cave. The wind of every footstep was too strong to fight against.
133221211111222212.title: No chance

1332212111112222121.content:
As the three old year runs, his steps change as he lifts a foot higher and higher with a hand reaching down to it. He starts to scratch between steps, losing ground to the far larger brother as much as he tried to keep up. There was an inch on his foot and it was driving him crazy. Every scratch moved mud, dirt and fur all over miles and miles of land, at least to his 'big' brothers.

D'rie and Rallie ducked and held on as their 'little' brother scraped across hundreds of miles of ground with just a finger on part of a toe. Truth be told, this was the smallest the cat had ever been, his old self before he found his powers was even bigger than this. At last, there was no chance to avoid the brother's finger, it carved a trench through dead skin and hurled the little creatures over the side. The force toppled any scale and knocked the two out.

Tarsi found his itch and slammed his foot down with it now resolved. The near nano sized creatures were rammed into by the downward force and wound up under the foot caught to a pad. The tiny duo was surrounded in sweat that would flood lakes and held against the titan's toes by the immense gravitational force of something so large. They were in a 'valley' of the grooves so the ground was no threat, at least not yet.

After a few minutes, the little creatures came to. They floated on the ocean of sweat and saw under them specks of dust from the dirt path measuring in miles and little pebbles that filled their visions. For now though, that seemed to be all that they could do. The cub's foot was too large to be affected by them and their was no way quite to escape yet.

Up above in the world of titans, Tarsi picked up the pace to keep up with his brother. The carnival was in sight and so was all the fun in the world!
1332212111112222121.title: Itch and under

choices: Does D'rie get snuffed out of existence?
Does the young wolf move on?
1332212112.content: D'rie opened his eyes to the young wolf's dirty toes surrounding him, liked the entire mountain chain of the rockys.
1332212112.title: Dirty Toes

133221212.content:
The sound was Ralie, the youngest of the wolves coming. At three years old he barely made the two foot mark but he was always wanting to go around with the 'big kids' or at least play with them, including the smallest intelligent thing in the house. D'rie was of course dwarfed by the 'little' wolf, though had the shrinking never happened the kid wouldn't have even been knee high. The shrinking had happened though and right now, that giant was coming this way as a mechination of destruction.

"Hey, Ralie, big buddy, could you back up!" D'rie yelled, the splayed toes of the titan covered miles and miles of ground each, making the rather un-coordinated cub a big risk. Of course, sometimes being heard was a bigger risk.

The wolf's enormous ears swiveled around for a second or two, the sound waves coming at him were smaller than even the tinniest insect's buzzing but all canids had remarkable hearing. "Bro-ser" Ralie said, for just an instant before charging forward, "ee play! ee play!"

If D'rie was scared before, he was going through horror right now. Somehow, he could cover immense distances despite micorscopic feet and legs, but even the run of a 3 year old was faster than him. His smallest pad alone stretched 10 miles, and that wasn't even the whole toe. Figure then, the kid's running with his longest stride possible, even jumping more than stepping, and you get 200 miles per step.

For the feline, there was nothing to do, the kid couldn't be outrun and the toes were too wide to get out of their path if he knew where that was. Not to mention if not for the gravity of the wood, the cat would've been launched into the air. Then, in an instant, the sky was dark as five mountains coming off of a country slammed into the ground all around D'rie. He opened his eyes to...

The wolf's name is Takota. Barely a young adult at the age of two, youve already reached adult hieght (at around 6-7 ft but you havent stopped growing). Takota has already mastered the art of fighting and has only lost several times as a cub. Takota is nearly completly jet black with the exception of a reddish hue on your stomach. His rank in the legions of his pack, the Spetics, is what they call a Oralsa which is the equivialant of captian for the humans.
When Takota loped up behind Kheshk, the Salick or general, he asked him "What do you think this means?". You quickly find the deadly sticks and carefully grab a mouthful gingerly strapping the sticks to the still running ray. after all the vital areas were stuffed with dynamite all of the scout group ran for there lives as a huge explosion ripped through the forest.

1413.title: Other

choices: five hundred foot tall male hyena
Five hundred foot tall female hyena
141331.content:
The commander gave a nervous gulp. "The hyenas", he asked somewhat shaken. "Yes sir", an engineer confirmed. The commander had good reason to be nervous, no one knew anything about the hyenas. They didn't know if they were primitive, modern or more advanced then anyone. And any who made an attempt to find out were never heard from again. The hyenas made there home in barren twisted cliffs. That was the limit of the information. No knew more and no one really wanted to know more, instead they had rumors. Rumors of how twisted or insane the dogs were, rumors that maybe they didn't exist at all.

The commander took a shaky breath and started to ask, "How big", before a loud cackling shook the very city. Then an earth shaking quake knocked the cats off their feet. "Status report", he shouted before the power cut out and the generators went online. Just then a tiger rushed in looking terrified.

"Sir", he shouted. "You better come outside."

The commander a group of soldiers and several scientist headed for the outside to see what had happened and what had the tiger so spooked. They reached a balcony and almost immediately tried to flee back inside. But a gigantic voice shook them to the bones and caused them to remain frozen where they stood staring up in the shadow of a colossal beast.

"Aw don't run", the beast said playfully. "I just want to talk."

The gang of cat's looked up to the face of a smirking giant
141331.title: Hyena

choices: The cats try and fail to fight back
1413311.content:
The commander couldn't believe his eyes. A five hundred foot tall hyena was staring down at them, it's cock and balls simply hanging over a building. It's sheer size terrified him. The male in question was butt naked and gave him and the rest of his men a twisted smile. The commander looked past the hyena and saw a trail of destruction in it's wake. Toppled buildings. rubble lining the street and large masses of bloody broken bodies in deep paw prints. A chuckle escaped the giant's lips. A toothy smile greeted the now shaken cats.

"Yeah", he said. "Little bugs should have gotten out the way." He gave a small laugh. As if the deaths of so many did little more then amuse him. The commander was about to shout up at the cruel giant but as if sensing his frustration the hyena held up a finger and waved it in front of his face. "Now, now, little bugs should be careful what they say to giants", he teased. "Other wise stuff like this happens".

The hyena turned away from the commander and faced a skyscraper that stood only two heads taller then the hyena. Then the ground cracked at the hyena shifted his weight jumped up in the air and maneuvered through the air and delivered an unnecessary and flashy round house kick through the building's middle. Glass exploded outwards as metal bent and broke. Cats screamed as several of them flew through the air and even more died upon impact. Half the building was sent flying across the city colliding through several smaller structures before coming to a grinding halt.

The bottom half of the skyscraper stood where it was even s the giant landed gracefully and heavily on the street below. The hyena walked up to admire his work smiling nastily down at the surviving workers before stepping back and delivering three kicks in rapid succession knocking the other half of the tower to the ground. Satisfied with his work the giant never losing his evil grin turned back to the shocked Commander and onlookers. He leaned over the balcony that began to crack under his weight. "Consider your words carefully, bug", he said as his hot breath washed over them.

The commander could only glare up in fury and fear at the hyena. That skyscraper was the crowning technological achievement of the cats. And in seconds this monster had destroyed it and several other building all while killing thousands of lives. The cat calmly tried to collect himself before addressing the hyena. This wasn't easy to do. But the commander was a lion and lions aren't cowards. "He took a shaky breath as the giant's breath played with his mane.

"Hyena, what do you", he started to ask only for the dog to interrupt him mid sentence.

"Hyena, so informal. Is that how you address all your guests by their species?"

"Fine", the commander replied. "What is your name?"

The hyena somehow managed to widen his grin. 'Do you think a little bug like you has the right to ask me for my name?" He asked playfully.

"What do I call you then", the commander asked starting to loose his temper.

"What do you think you call someone as great as me?"

A few words sprang to mind but the lion stifled those insults out of fear for his city. "Your Grace", he asked.

"That's better", the hyena agreed. "What do you want to ask little bug?"

"What do you want, your grace?" The commander asked through barely contained anger.

"Why little bug", the hyena started. "We want to do to you what were going to do the other species."

"And that is, your grace?"

"We hyenas have always been very few. It's not easy to survive where we are from, but we have a dream. A dream to one day rise above the other species and play with them. When one of your scouts showed up and kindly told us about your little plan, we persuaded the mice to interfere and redirect the blast against our wolf-en brethren and aim it at us with intention to grow. They were more then happy to agree when we promised to wipe out their enemies. A shame they didn't ask us to promise to spare their lives to. Why at this very moment they've probably been stamped out existence. The mice were always very small and their cites not much bigger."

"So when you say play, my grace you mean..." the commander trailed off.

"I mean wreck your little cities, squish you little bugs, convince you that serving us as our slaves and food, oh and as our toys."

The commander went pale at this news. "But first", the hyena pushed himself up and broke part of the balcony off, and began walking around the facility. Then without any warning he struck his arm though the ceiling of the lab and began rooting around for something. Then giving a small aha pulled out the shrink ray and moved back around to the front of the building showing his prize to the cats. Then without any warning he closed his fist and crushed the shrink ray in his hand. The sound of crunching metal filled the air, when the hyena opened his hand and showed a small crumpled ball to the cats. Then turning around he winded up his arm and chucked the ball as hard as he could until it went plop into the ocean.

The cats looked up at the hyena in absolute fear now. "Always best to crush an enemy's final hope before you seal their fate. Now then..."

14231212122.content:
Aldric continued stomping through the city, killing several humans with each step he took. He delighted in watching the humans try to desperately run away, only to be squashed in the end. "And so i kept applying pressure on him until his head popped like a grape!" said Jacob reminiscing about all of the fun he had.

"Daddy do you ever regret attacking the wolves?'' asked Billy.

"The only thing i regret is not leaving any for you. Snuffing out a life under your hoof is the best feeling in the world! And as far as i know all of the smaller races are now gone" said Jacob.

Billy then decided to go outside and play with the other children. He then saw his best friend Lisa walk by.

"Hey Billy, was your father telling stories again?" she asked.

"Yeah... this suck, i want to crush a tiny anthro too..."

What kind of society do these large pachyderms have?

Primitive: The elephants live in a tribal like society that only recently mastered fire.

Developed: These large beings are roughly on par with the other species

Advanced: In addition to their existing size advantage, the elephants are technologically advance enough to put everyone else to shame.
14331.title: Elephants

choices: The elephants and the rodents both grew
143311.content:
Everyone knows that the long, near endless expanse of plains to the east of the continent is elephant territory. These massive beings are, by any standard, primitive. Their technology has has only recently reached the point where they learned to use fire, and their weapons are nothing more than simple spears, clubs, and bows. Of course, in spite of this, none of the other species dare to attack these tribal beings due to the sheer size and strength of them. When it's widely believed that a single elephant can decimate an entire squadron of any other race, the general consensus from everyone else is to simply leave them alone and let them do their own thing. Thankfully, the pachyderms haven't shown any aggression in recent years. The elephants themselves have mixed views on the outsiders, but ultimately have adopted the same "let them be" mentality so long as there is no aggression against them.
This general fear has minimized any real interaction, though they have allowed some outsiders to live among them, mostly various rodent refugees escaping the cat nations hoping the elephants reputation alone would keep them safe. Though the tribes welcomed these wayward souls, there seemed to be some disdain towards the advanced culture and lifestyles of these smaller beings. These tribal people are lead by a chief who despite his more than ample stomach (which their culture views as a sign of his ruling social status) could easily lift a building.

One day a strange light bathed the community. No-one was sure what was going on, but something was definitely happening as a result of it.
143311.title: Primitive Elephants

14332.title: Cows

choices: The cheif now king of the gods being spoiled by your servants
Rod a mischievous god playing with the horse resistance
143321.content:
The cows and bulls are a primitive species, but this is their choice. They whole heartily believe that all species should follow the natural order. That you shouldn't question the natural order, that the big and strong should be in charge while the small and weak obey. Never developing , never inventing never tampering with the earth other then gathering food and sowing seeds and just let nature take it's course. Of course they also believe that they stand at the very top of the pecking order and that all others should follow their example and serve under them, happily, and that they and they alone should prosper, and all others should be grateful for their continued exsitances.

But being primitive and without weapons or armor other then their loin clothes it is a difficult message to get across to the more technological species, especially the territorial horses, or the war mongering elephants, and even approaching the wolves or cats was out of the question. Indeed so much as approaching them has led to many deaths and many more enslavements. Now there are only a few handful of tribes left. Many have gone into hiding and have abandoned their belief but the largest group continues their crusade. But even the are starting to feel like it is hopeless, or at least it was until the "beam form the sky" as they called it made them all two hundred feet tall giants.

The sudden growth spooked them at first, but their chief, a battle hardened bull, with a voice of steel, quieted the ruckus. All paid attention to what the chief had to say next.

"My fellow kin," his voice boomed across the plains. "I am sure many of you have many questions as to why we now stand as giants among this world." A wave whispers passed over the crowd. "But fear not, for I have the answer. The earth has answered our prayers and has determined that we our now worthy of realizing our belief. Our growth is a sign that we are the rulers of this world and most educate the lesser beings of their place in it. We must make haste and establish our rule so that all the mortals will learn their place it. Over now is the reign of our inferiors and now and forever is the bovine's time to rule."

Shouts of glee erupted from the tribe as at long last their dream would be realized.

"But what about the other clans of our people", a warrior bravely asked.

The chief gave a dismissive snort. "Those traitors abandoned or way of life they, will only have the honor of gazing up at us and lamenting their folly as they serve with all the others. Now enough talk it i time to claim what is rightfully ours."

And with that, The Cows began stamping out their authority over their world. The horses and elephants tried their best to fight back against the giants. but they were little more then insects compared to their new "gods". And as mighty as the cats, wolves, and mice were, they were no match for their oppressive overlords.

Furthermore it was discovered that the size ray had an added effect. When one was shrunk with it their lifespan was reduced to little more then an average insect depending on how small the target was. This was to make the wolves obedience and servitude achievable in a mater of months. But when something was grown with the ray that life span would drastically increase making said individual retain their youth and vigor for hundreds if of thousands of years. Sadly the exact amount of time a lifeform had could not be tested as both the size ray and a vast majority of the mice were crushed beneath bovine hooves.

Within two months of the onslaught that took place most of the civilizations that the developed species had built had been destroyed. And in a hundred years life without their gods was but a fleeting story. But it still inspired hope among the lesser species and some even tried revolting. Only to be laughed at and treated as toys by the cows. Still while it was a fruitless uphill battle the lesser beings fought it in the vain hope that they could be free from their cruel gods. None believed this more then the traitors and non believers of the bovine race. As they had often suffered harsh treatment and impossible challenges by their dismissive actions in the past.

But centuries had passed and the cows had decided the mortals were allowed their illusions. After all the gods had made sure the that their servants understood that only they could create and invent the rest were stuck using nothing but their hands and small rocks. While the gods did make stone weapons they kept to their primate ways, seeing no point in fixing what wasn't broken. Now how will the mortals live in an unfair life alongside their gods and how do their gods deal with them. Take control of one of them and find out how they deal with every day life. You are

However the horses believed themseleves to be greater then the other more developed races and thought that they were mightier then anything the wolves or cats could ever hope to be. 1443112.content:
The horses were minding their own business until everything began to get a lot bigger. They didn't notice at first but when one of them exclaimed that the grass was growing around their village, the others quickly took note. People began to notice that the crops they tilled now towered above them. A few claimed to have to fight off giant worms and spiders. Pandemonium hit the village as several of the horses were panicking over what was going on. The chief of the horses tried to maintain order but it was to hectic. Then the ground began to shake.

The tinies stood stock still as if to make sure what they just heard was their imagination. Then it happened again and again. The horses looked towards the sound and watched as a hulking and massive figure moved towards their tiny home. The monstrous being's shadow blotted out the sun as it moved closer and closer to them. With each step the giant made sent bigger and bigger quakes through the ground. Thankfully the giant stopped just before their little village so at least the horses weren't going to be crushed by this giant. They watched as it looked down at them. "Now what do we have", it asked. Few had been too scared to look up at the titan but those that did realized it was...
1443112.title: Follow the entire tribe and see what happens

choices: They were now the smallest species! (Other species stay the same)
In addition, one or more (or all) other species see some sort of size adjustment
14433.content:
The Elephants were by far the largest species. As with the Horses, the Elephants were not technologically advanced. In fact, they were the most primitive. This may have been due to their immense size, which made them naturally so powerful that they did not need any technology to defend themselves. However, where the Elephants did differ from the Horses was in their warlike nature. The Horses were relatively peaceful agrarians which tended to keep to themselves in their own vast lands, but the Elephants (despite being Herbivores) desired to have supremacy over the other species, and would frequently invade the lands of neighboring species to raid them of food, resources, or even slaves. On occasion, the Elephants would invade a land just for the sake of owning the land itself, and they would annex this land into their growing empire, much to the dismay of the species that lived in these lands.

The Elephants had an enormous need for food to sustain their massive bodies, which tended to have a devastating effect on the lands they conquered. Though they possessed little technology, they had no problem tearing apart entire forests using the incredible strength of their massive trunks which could easily rip a full grown tree out of the ground. Lands which had been forests, were converted into Savannas by the Elephants as they devoured everything in sight. Many species which favored life in the forests came to hate the Elephants for this reason. But no one could do anything to stop them, because the Elephants were too large and powerful.

Of all the species who came to hate and fear the Elephants, there was none who despised them more than the species of Mice. The Mice were the opposite of the Elephants in almost every way. The Mice were the smallest species, in contrast to the Elephants who were the largest. An entire village of Mice could be squished under an Elephant's foot, and the Elephant would barely even notice. Mice farmers would store their grain in massive (to the Mice) silos, but hungry Elephants who came upon these grain silos would greedily devour them in one massive gulp. Even though the Elephants were Herbivores, they would not stop their gorging to make sure there wasn't any mice inside of the food they were eating. Unknown numbers of Mice were inadvertently chewed up or swallowed alive to digest inside of Elephants massive bloated bellies as the Elephants helped themselves to the bounty of the Mice's lands.

Fortunately, most Mice lived in cities, which the Elephants tended to ignore because there was very little food there. Many Mice cities were technically annexed and part of Elephant territory now, but in practice the Elephant rulers tended to leave them alone. The Mice were far too small to make for good slaves to labor in the fields, but the Mice could help the Elephants in another way by providing them with advanced technology. Specifically, technology pertaining to Agriculture. The Elephants were too arrogant to do the work of growing their own crops themselves, but they were more than happy to share this technology with their slaves. It was a common sight in Elephant lands to see Wolves, Horses, Cats, and all the other species toiling in the fields to provide food for their Elephant masters.

Whereas the Elephants were the most primitive of all the species, the Mice were by far the most scientifically advanced. Though it was other species which worked in the Elephant's fields, they often did so using technology such as advanced fertilizer formulas, genetically modified seeds, Mice tractors (scaled up in size to be used by non-Mice species), and so on. The Elephants would not allow these technologies to leave their lands. The Mice were considered to be the property of the Elephant empire, so any technology that the Mice invented was likewise considered to be Elephant property. The Elephants didn't use the technology themselves or know how to, but it was for their slaves to use for the benefit of the Elephants and no other purpose. The Elephants made this clear in their diplomacy with the independent realms that if they found out there was Mice technology being used, they would go to war with whoever was using it, and this threat was enough to keep everyone else in check.

So somewhat paradoxically, the Elephants were the most primitive species living at a stone age level, but at the same time their empire possessed the world's most advanced technologies, because of the Mice being part of their empire.

But what the Elephants did not see coming was that the scientifically advanced Mice slaves have been secretly working on a secret technology to liberate themselves and turn the tables on their Elephant masters, by taking away the one advantage the Elephants had over them: their size.

Huge Tesla coils began to be constructed in the Mice cities, and the Elephants just shrugged at the sight of this, assuming it was some new agricultural technology that would help boost the crop yields even further. They never saw it coming when these huge Tesla coils came to life all of a sudden one night and there was a loud explosion as lightning lit up the sky in all directions for thousands of miles.

The next day, when the sun rose, the Elephants were horrified to discover that...
14433.title: Elephants

choices: Lupita - Dumbina's beautiful female Wolf chambermaid slave
Rocinante - A handsome male Horse slave that now serves as a royal guard
144331.content:
"Those pesky Mice better have invented something amazing, for them to have disrupted my beauty sleep!" grumbled Empress Dumbina, as she yawned, rubbing her eyes with her massive grey elephant hands.

Loud explosions and bright flashes of light had kept her up half the night. Though similar to thunder and lightning, it was somehow eerily different, and there was no doubt it had something to do with those crazy Mice scientists and their wacky experiments. There were times Dumbina considered squishing the whole lot of them under her feet, but they were just far too useful with the advanced technology they provided that was far beyond anything her species could ever produce.

Dumbina was the Matriarch of the Elephant empire, the largest and more powerful empire the world had ever known. She inherited the empire about 20 years earlier when her mother made the great journey to the ancient Elephant boneyard, where all Royal elephants go when their time has come. Being so large and powerful, it was almost unheard of for an Elephant to die from anything other than natural causes, so an Elephant always knew when their time was coming to an end, and they would make their way to the graveyard to die. Dumbina felt like she was on top of the world. She knew that her reign would last for many years to come. During the time of her reign, the Elephant empire has grown to become the largest in the world. She began to dream of total world conquest, and becoming the Matriarch of the entire planet. She had no doubt in her mind that one day this would become reality. She was wrong.

A loud rumble in her huge belly turned her attention away from thoughts of world domination towards the more immediate matter of breakfast. She rolled over on her side, expecting her feet to touch the floor of her royal bedchamber and then make her way to the dining hall just as she had done every morning... but something was strangely very wrong. Dumbina opened her eyes to find that her bed now stretched far and wide in a massive distance, as if her bed had been swapped with the bed of a giant. But... she was the largest giant in the world. How could this be?

"Guards! Servants!" Dumbina shouted. She then raised her trunk upwards and blasted it as loudly as she could, like the sound of a great Trumpet.

A few moments past, and then ground began to shake, and she heard the door of her bedchamber creak open, except the sound was magnified to an impossible level.

"Mi'lady? Is everything allright? I thought I heard you call out, but the sound was very faint..." boomed the voice of a massive form that poked its head inside of the door.

Empress Dumbina recognized that voice. It was the voice of...

15.content:
Amstrad, 13th Mouse-Lord of the ruling house Woodbright listens intently. A tiny speaker relays all that is said in the Cat weapon command centre. Fat crumbs from a particularly large Crouton fall from his mouth.

"Excellent! Not only is our hidden listening device working exactly as intended, but I declare this is finest Crouton I have tasted in years! You scouts do you credit, Master Boardrunner Dolly."
"Oh thakyou sir," says Dolly, bowing and fawning precipitously, "yes. Yes Indeed. You are indeed too kind sir. Yes." He shoots the assembled others a gloating, triumphant look and is pleased to recieve a chrous of guarded, envious glances in return.

"Soon," continues Amstrad past a mouthful of bread, "the Cats will discover our sabotage, by which time they will be no larger than us! Smaller even - shrunk by the weapon of their very own design and construction - the sheer blessed irony of it. The boot will be on the other foot, then! Oh yes - we have had thousands of years to ferment our retribution, AND THEY WILL TASTE IT! THEY WILL TASTE IT FROM OUR OTHER-FOOTED BOOTS!"

Terry, a stupid mouse with only three whiskers raises a hand.
"We don't wear boots," he says, "an' also that ain't irony. Irony would be like if-"
"Shut up, Terry you three-whiskered fool." Snaps Amstrad.
